reviewContent: This airport offers zero amenities to the traveler. Probably the most boring place I have waited for a flight. Old equipment at TSA slows progress in getting screened. Few restaurants and even fewer bars. Zero lounges and almost no place to charge a device. It's definitely a miserable enough place that I would no longer consider a trip to New Mexico if it involves this airport!

commentHeader: everyone needs to charge their devices
reviewContent: Only wall outlets and had to try 3 different ones to find one that worked. It's 2023 and everyone needs to charge their devices. First trip to Albuquerque. Attended balloon Fiesta which brings in over 200 million. Think city could put some into upgrading airport. Not happy.
Warning to all ADA travelers. I you have a wheelchair there is no transportation services offered at this airport! No shuttles, taxi, or local services but the public bus.

commentHeader: extremely disappointed in the way they handled security
reviewContent: I was extremely disappointed in the way they handled security. Initially I was thrilled at the process and not separating people from their luggage like so many others. However, one of my bags got 'flagged' (ended up being for a stack of business cards) and it sat waiting to be checked for over 15 minutes. During that time I asked 4 different people about it and was brushed off with comments like 'They're sending someone over' or 'I'm sure they'll take care of it" and they just walked off. It almost made me miss my flight and was just completely NOT okay. If they had even spoken to me and treated me like a person that mattered it would have been more palatable, but this negative experience will override any positive about this airport.

commentHeader: a nice concept, but one that needs some improvements
reviewContent: ABQ is a nice concept, but one that needs some improvements. For starters: If you have TSA Pre-Check here, you're golden. Security is an efficient and friendly process. If you don't have Pre-Check, then the service, at least for a small airport, can be quite non-communicative, abrasive and slow. The pueblo-inspired architecture and interior design of the airport render it one of the most beautiful small airports in the USA, and the post-security viewing area of the runway and mountains is the sort of thing that more airports in this country need. However, it's not always easy to enjoy the design and the views when the tile and carpet flooring and seating throughout the airport are dirty and, for a lack of better words, dilapidated and outdated. Speaking of seating, there really isn't enough of it, in my opinion. The signage directing you to amenities, services and locations throughout the airport is helpful, but also outdated. The dining and shopping options are fine for a small airport, so no real complaints. Some people complain about the rental car facility being separate from the terminal and requiring a shuttle bus, but, honestly, the bus runs frequently and the ride is pretty short. Everything is easily accessible from I-25 and downtown Albuquerque. With a little modernization and polishing, ABQ has the potential be as good as new again.

Very frustrating - today 6/27, 11.30 am, B gates going through pre-check TSA my husband was returning with our son (12) to San Diego. The lady at TSA said “our son couldn’t go through security without an ID”. Patently false - he flew RT to Texas the week prior. This is a training issue and she almost caused them to miss their flight! Please train your staff!

commentHeader: I have had horrid customer service
reviewContent: Avoid American Airlines at this airport. I have had horrid customer service in December 2020 and January 2021. I had a female ticketing agent charge me $170 for 1 overweight bag (54 lbs) because she claimed my husband's military orders were dated in March. Orders aren't posted the month you transfer ma'am. As a 17 year active duty wife, I may know a thing or two. Then said "just because you are a military dependent doesn't mean you get free luggage". I never in my life have experienced such horrid disrespect. On top of it I am a COVID crisis relief RN. I was blown away and have since vowed to never fly American again.

This airport can’t seem to handle the passenger traffic. I was flying American on May 21, my flight was delayed to the point that I wouldn’t make my transfer. I was bumped to the next day and the check-in lines were so incredibly long that I missed my flight the next morning and was forced to fly standby. I have heard similar things from friends flying Southwest Airlines at this airport

Very rude TSA, been through many time and always felt it was very quick and easier to get through other than the airport staff. Not the airline staff, they are great. But TSA are almost always rude, barely smile and speak down to people going through. Not just my family but others around us in the line, and really there is nothing you can say. It is not necessary to always look like you are in a bad mood and don't want to be at work.

Do not arrive too early. We arrived 3 hours before-my friend was flying on a slightly earlier flight and I was told to wait outside as my flight was slightly later. No preliminary information.so had to wait an hour. Finally allowed inside the building where there were 5 security checks - really strange as the checks involved the same things. After all that my friends plane was still on the tarmac as we took off. Airport was clean and seemed well organised once inside but being kept outside was risky.

New and pleasant airport terminal. Quite spacious. Free Wi-Fi. Security was reasonably efficient and courteous. Limited food and beverage service. Quick baggage retrieval. Extremely clean toilets. Very close to city, hotels and restaurants. I would highly recommend Alexandria International (AEX) when traveling to Central or Northern Louisiana.

Super easy to navigate this tiny welcoming airport, parking garage fees are reasonable, car rental is close by, drop off and pickup is efficient, airport management does actually care, facilities are clean, food is sparse but there and it is secure. Top notch tiny regional airport!

commentHeader: overcrowded with unhappy and angry passengers
reviewContent: We were returning back home to Virginia via ORD and our ASE to ORD flight got cancelled. The main lobby and check-in/ticketing area of Aspen Airport does not have a vending machine for even water. TSA did not allow already checked-in passengers to go through security and wait in the gates section due to some "safety" issue due to overcrowding in the gates area. We had to wait five hours. Twice I went to the bathroom and through a windowed door you could see the gate area with FEW people while the front of the airport building was overcrowded with unhappy and angry passengers. I already sent my complaint to American Airlines. This issue of no water, soda or food for hours is not acceptable in todays world. For sure I have no desire to visit Aspen due to this awful airport and airline experience.

The employees in baggage, customs, and particularly the security area before catching connecting flights, were rude and yelling at people. Even the lady announcing luggage claim carousel on the intercom was too loud and sounded angry. This has been a problem for a long time. Frankly, I'm embarrassed for the horrible first impressions for foreigners entering the US. Fix it please.
Terrible airport. Avoid. Immigration had 2 officers for over 500 passengers. Took over an hour to enter for 1 hour. Rude and unhelpful staff. I thought MIA was bad but Atlanta is worse.

commentHeader: trash and food on the floor
reviewContent: Horrible, gross, totally messy, dirty, trash and food on the floor of the waiting areas, people almost camping around in the waiting areas, where is the cleaning staff? This is unbelievable.

commentHeader: a mad house with no structure
reviewContent: On 18 July I traveled to Hartsfield-jackson airport to pick up my daughter and family. I have traveled throughout the US, Europe and Asia. The experience in Atlanta airport was the worst in my 75 years on this earth. All parking on the domestic side was full. I was directed to the International terminal parking by one of the many rude employees there. In the end, I parked off site until my daughter arrived picking her up at exit S2. Honestly, 'the fish rots from the head down' I ask that Governor Kemp order a top down evaluation of senior management at the Atlanta airport. The place is a mad house with no structure and few employees who care a whit about the clientele. Suggest they use the airport in Seoul to model their way ahead. If the Koreans can get it so right so can we Americans.

Never connect through ATL on an international flight. You have people getting off flights from 2 different ends of the airport and one side has to walk all the way to the other side to get in line behind hundreds of people. Once you make it through customs and show your passport, then you pick up your checked bags and redeposit them around the corner. At this point you think you are done and can head to your gate, but no. Now you have to wait in another long line to go through security again. This is after you have been on a long international flight. Like seriously, what could I have picked up from the jet bridge to standing in the customs line? You finally make it through security and then you have to catch the train to your terminal! I have never seen such foolishness! None of this makes sense at all! If I cleared security once, why should I have to do it again?  There has to be some logic, but I don't understand it!

A couple of illogicals at Hartsfield. Arriving from international flight to get to Marta (as instructed by 3 different staff) traveler is required to go through the security checkpoint. This not just inconveniences tired traveler arriving from international flight that has already gone through customs, but also additionally chokes always long security check lines. At domestic terminal 3 of the staff man entrance to restrooms, and if you're arriving from the ticket counter side they instruct you to go around, back through food court, by entrance to security checkpoint and only if you're arriving from that side you can enter the restroom. Not only inconvenience to traveler but also waste time of 3 if the staff. Is that really necessary? It seems Hartsfield is moving in direction opposite from progress.

commentHeader: some of the most rude people
reviewContent: This was my absolute worst experience I’ve ever had in an airport. It was not just the TSA although yes, they were their typical bossy, irritating organization. But the staff trying to guide us from an international arrival through passport, control, and baggage retrieval and whatever else were some of the most rude people I’ve ever encountered. I was so upset that this was going to be some of the people on my flights first experience in the United States, and they’re being yelled at and laughed at. If you fly, you know that an unfamiliar airport can be confusing. People would ask questions. Sometimes two people would ask the same question. One person I gave my passport to just flick his wrist slightly and looked at me like this. Is your passport take it the security wanted to see inside my bag and set it aside. It sat completely unattended for 10 minutes. I didn’t want to say anything to anybody because by this point, my experience had been so lousy, I figured they would purposely extend it and I might miss my connection. Restaurants are overcrowded lines of 100 people long at a Wendy’s. Bathrooms you can’t navigate because they’re too tight and people are toting bags all over the place. Flights that get delayed are not uncommon, but they seem to be more than common at this airport. I will purposely pay extra to never have to fly through this airport again. If I never see Atlanta, I will be happy. Who has a hub there, needs to act or they are going to lose customers. Because I have zero interest of flying through their hub ever again.

This airport is to be avoided if at all possible. Like many large airports, it is very busy; unlike many other airports, though, the vast majority of staff have no interest in helping anyone. Parking is full - staff waves you away without any information about alternative lots. Baggage check lines are long, staff sits on their butts, occasionally helping a customer every 5 minutes or so. Security officers are so busy yelling instructions to everyone that they can't answer a question, then lose their marbles if you do something wrong (I took my laptop out of my case like the majority of other security lines; the women started screaming like I was a child). Most restaurants inside the airport have employees staring at their cell phones, and both the service time and food quality reflect this. The only positive I can write is that this airport does allow direct flights to many places. However, I have begun to look at other airports (e.g., Columbia, SC and Charlotte, NC) to use - the extra hour or two drive is worthwhile to avoid ATL.

Our first flight was a bit late, no clear directions in airport and most of the staff are mean as hell and look lost themselves. Be warned, you won't have time to get all the way across the airport and catch a connecting flight they end all boarding sessions 30 minutes early so it is very misleading and the staff are very mean spirited.

Atlanta wants to be an international city but the international terminal at Heathrow provides the least convenient airport experience I have ever encountered. On arrival in Atlanta, if you want to take public transport — the MARTA subway train — you have to get a bus from the international terminal back to the domestic terminal where the train station is located. The busses run infrequently, are hard to identify, crowded, and are manned by surly drivers, They drive you around the whole large airport so it takes around 45 minutes. We’d already waited that long for a bus just to come AND spent an hour getting through a long passport control queue. Why London airports can have e-gates you breeze through in minutes and Atlanta cannot is beyond me. If you think you’ll avoid all this hassle by renting a car, think again as to access the rental car centre you have to take the same slow airport bus to domestic PLUS then a shuttle out to the rental hub. All of it adds up to it taking a very long time to just get away from the airport after an already long international flight. Signage after baggage pick-up is also very poor which makes me feel very sorry for non-English speakers or really anyone arriving in Atlanta for the first time.

TSA wait on Monday 5/13/24 was over an hour with 3 TSA people working. I was also told that I could leave my iPad in my carryon, but at BOS Logan, that was not allowed and further it had to be placed in a separate bin. I appreciate security, and would also appreciate that they are trained properly. What else goes through unseen?  Departing BOS Delta 363 on Friday 5/17/24 arriving ATL Terminal A, the ladies restroom line spilled well out onto the concourse. When I got inside, there were numerous stalls out of service, several sinks out of service and no soap in several dispensers. Logan airport was super clean and very nice. Surely ATL can do better.

Unfortunately this is my new home airport. I travel every other week for work from ATL to several other cities. The staff at ATL airport is by far the worst I’ve seen at any airport. Clear staff are horrible! I’ve had a problem with my ID the last 5-7 times I’ve gone through and no one has said why, then I go to New Orleans and Orlando Airport and they both told me what the issue was and how to fix it. Security and TSA are rude and power hungry. They scream across the lobby at guests, they ignore any questions and treat travelers as if we are beneath them-all because they know you will comply because you have no other choice. They are bullies. Almost anyone you speak to at the airport acts like they are annoyed that they have to do their job. I’m actually shocked when someone is friendly.

Me and my sister are flying out of country for the first time. During our time in this airport, we’ve had to ask where to go, what to do, etc., which is expected from newbie travelers. Every staff member, employee, and retail worker that we’ve experienced so far from McDonald’s to the Info desk has been nothing but rude. Horrible attitudes, not people friendly, and seems like they do not like taking the time out of their jobs to answer questions. I have been here for about 12 hours on a long connection, have gained very little answers to my questions, and I have met no kind people who work in this airport.

I would like to thank Kelvin for his assistance. Frontier is having issues with their app and were not helpful. Thought I was given a ticket, but it was not a boarding pass. After my 2nd trek back to the Frontier counter and heading for my 3rd, Kelvin not only got me fixed up and thru security quickly. I am in my late 60s and his help was greatly appreciated.

My husband and I flew into Atlanta from Amsterdam on April 25, 2024. We had a connecting flight to Birmingham, AL following that flight that we needed to make. When we reached the Custom's line we realized that the line was extremely long and slow moving. We had enough of a layover where there should have been plenty of time to make it to where we needed to be, but there were only a few custom's officers working the arrival of an entire international flight. We asked for help from multiple employees so that we could make our connecting flight and were told that they could not help us. We were told that we would just have to miss our flight and reschedule it for the next day! This was extremely frustrating because we had recently had a similar experience in Amsterdam where the staff there had bent over backwards and had done everything in their power to help us make our flight.... so we knew that things could be done better. They have a system worked out to assist passengers with occurrences like these. Atlanta employees need to take a training class from the Amsterdam airport. I would have expected so much more from such a large airport (in the United States no less), for which I guess I just had higher expectations. We were able to make our connecting flight but only because we had to make a desperate run through an extremely large airport which left us feeling miserable, exhausted, and stressed. All in all, it was just a very bad experience that didn't have to happen. Do better Atlanta!!

commentHeader: “one of the worst in the USA”
reviewContent: Atlanta international airport is by far one of the worst in the USA. The customs process is excruciating, the officers don’t know how to properly separate the visitors and citizens line, the process to travel from the international terminal to domestic or for a rental car is by way of one shuttle bus that runs every 25 mins. This is by far the worst process I have ever seen in an airport, 3rd world countries do a whole better job than this, this is just flat out horrible.

I am horrified at the ignorance and lack of knowledge of the airport staff. There is a complete "it's not my problem" or "I can't help you" attitude ingrained in the work culture there. There is no way I should be led on a wild goose chase around the airport because no one has a clue or cares to find out where I was supposed to get my connecting flight. I wasn't allowed on my flight when I got to the gate with 5 min to spare. It is appalling the lack of knowledge from the staff and then being met with shrugs. I'm absolutely disgusted with the staff there.

commentHeader: did not supply the wheelchair assistance
reviewContent: We had a horrible experience because they did not supply the wheelchair assistance that we requested. Our trip was from Salt Lake City to Atlanta then to Liberia, Costa Rico. Our trip home, we made a point of asking for wheelchair assistance. On our trip home, our flight was delayed an hour, so we had less time to go through customs. The wheelchair assistance was not there when we exited the terminal. There was a stray wheelchair so my wife pushed me. We kept on asking airport personnel for help and they kept on saying it is not my job. Some people offered to get someone, but that never panned out. When we picked up our bags because it was an international flight, we had three bags on the wheelchair with Ken (the person in the wheelchair) holding a wheeled 40 lb bag with a duffle bag attached to it while his wife tried to navigate to customs. At one point, a TSA official asked to take our bags, which we accepted. However we thought they would stay with us but they disappeared. We finally found the wheelchair assistance people and they did get us assistance, but was irritated that we were upset. They told us that our bags would be at our final destination and to quit worrying. They eventually took us to our terminal, although the person whined about how far it was. When we got there, the doors were closed but Delta allowed us to board. In Salt Lake, the wheelchair assistance was there and cheerfully helped us get to the luggage claim. However, I got a text from Delta stating that our luggage was still in Atlanta.

Not only did one of the biggest airports in the US cannot open enough security lanes, but also there are over 100 TSA agents who do absolutely nothing and berate people while they are going through security. I waited an hour through security so to people who did the body scan berated me about my appearance and shirt. It’s too early in the morning and not warranted to be treating your customers this way. We pay good money for flights that are overpriced anyway. The least we can get is 5-star customer service. There is obvious lack of training, lack of discipline, and lack of vetting your employees to see if they have experience working with customers. Ridiculous.

commentHeader: two hours to snake through the initial screening
reviewContent: My husband and I returned from Italy January 24th, 2024. We had a lay-over in Atlanta and went through customs at the Atlanta airport. We were diverted to the line with connecting flights. It took two hours to snake through the initial screening, grab our bags, go through a second line, and finally go through TSA security. The lines all moved at a glacial pace. When we finally were at TSA to X-ray the bags, there were two lines: one moved efficiently, the line we were in was a nightmare. The agents working the screening chatted with each other, stood by sipping water, and blowing battery-powered fans at their faces. My husband and I just made our connecting flight to IAD.

The longest TSA line with the rudest TSA agents ever. One actually made an announcement that we needed to get on the "same page, same chapter, same book" because we were irritating her as it should be a quick process. If you have not traveled to an airport with the same type of system, how would one know?? It would be more professional to intermittently provide a courtesy announcement of how the system works.

commentHeader: some of the most rudest workers ever
reviewContent: Out of all the places that I’ve traveled in this world, Atlanta has some of the most rudest workers ever. They speak to customers as if they’re angry for having to perform their jobs. Remember, who’s paying your salaries. If you’re not happy doing your job then I suggest that you go into another occupation. To add insult to injury, upon my return from a previous trip, someone had broken into my vehicle, located right next to security cameras. I reported it to the police and media and was told that the airport would pay for the repairs. That never happened. Moreover, I’m convinced that it was an inside job.

The worst of the worst airports. Good luck finding anything with the lack of signage and the nasty attitude exhibited by all employees. I’ve flown with Delta the past three times out of this airport and they overbook the flight every time, making an already abysmal experience at this airport even worse. This airport needs to be heavily fined for its sins.

Chaotic and least effective airport. TSA in Atlanta airport has the most inefficient and rude staff I have encountered at any airport. They all need a course on customer service. I arrived at 9pm at the domestic departure, experienced Long line 200+ passengers were waiting and only 3 security tables were open!  Staff were rude and useless. TSA and CLEAR closed early and there's no special lane to handle the irregular cases. Apparently, staff were customed to observing bottlenecks and didn't even aware there was an issue! They should adjust accordingly whenever they see traffic jam, like most average airports would open more security tables at rush hour. I will avoid to transfer to ATL Hartsfield ever!

I’ve lived outside of the US for many years and have experienced many airports all over the world. Some were good and others, not as good. Common elements I’ve found in good airports is professionalism and positive interaction with customers. My experience with the Atlanta airport contained neither of these elements. The primary area of dysfunction is the TSA process. General interaction that staff has with customers is unprofessional. No instructions given to people when approaching the document scanner, then being rude when someone is confused about the process. I did not observe any positive interaction between security staff and customers. After getting this sense, I looked for positivity and saw no eye contact or smiles, but rather what appeared to be contempt for customers. I realize that airport security would be a difficult job, and that you would feel like you are dealing with the same issue over and over. However, I have been through countless airports where security was professional and positive. Everyone has to go through security, so a good experience is crucial to a positive view of the airport. Atlanta airport has many great features, but I would not recommend it to anyone based on the TSA experience. That is how negatively it impressed me. This area should be addressed to improve service to customers and make the airport what it is capable of being.

This is a very confusing airport. Too few signs giving directions and also to many needless signs and advertisement that clutter your attention. Also, way too few screens displaying flight departure information. Finally, not enough food stands for the amount of foot traffic. I will try to avoid Hartsfield the next time I need a connecting flight.

commentHeader: Concourse D was tragic, it felt dreary
reviewContent: I had a connection from Boston to South Bend on Delta airlines. Traveling through the terminal was easy enough, and the plane train was simple. My experience though in Concourse D was tragic. It felt dreary like it was an afterthought and the two restaurants I went to acted like I was an inconvenience. The first (Mustard seed) had me sitting there for a bit before finally letting me know the kitchen was closed, at 6:45pm. And the next, all 3 employees decided they wanted to be on their phones instead of help a guest. Its sad because I grew up in ATL area and used to fly out of Hartsfield all the time. I have fond memories, but nostalgia wasn't enough to save this experience. I will probably avoid Delta just to avoid having a flight connection here
TSA in Atlanta airport has the most inefficient and rude staff I have encountered at any airport!! They all need a course on customer service! Worst ever!

I fly often, domestic and occasionally international. ATL airport is poorly run as compared to other airports. It is always understaffed and very chaotic. There's never a wheelchair attendant available upon departure. I always have a family member push me to the gate, after obtaining a special pass. This is never necessary to do upon departing other airports, only Atlanta! They are fairly good at providing attendants upon de-planing. However, one afternoon there was 1 attendant for 7 wheelchairs. One by one she pushed us from the jetway to the terminal and there we sat for 1 hr. Those of us who could walk a little, we decided to attempt to walk to the plane train, by holding the wheelchair and walk behind it. The TSA line for wheelchair people is ridiculous. No one is there to supervise the bottleneck of abandoned wheelchairs as we wobble pass the checkpoint. Do not blame the attendants! Its not their fault! Its the fault of the upper managers because they are not doing a good job of managing! It's shameful! The last trip I took there was a manager at the TSA line who was drunk and stepping on people and bumping into us and he was loud and laughing and clowning around with workers. Atlanta airport is disgusting!

This is my home airport. It’s not bad considering the volume of people that pass through every day. TSA needs to be fully staffed and all machines working for the M-F business crowd. Also, why so hot? It’s barely fall and the airport is a balmy 80 degrees inside. Save energy, save the planet and keep it cooler. You’ve got people in the sky club stripped down to their tees. Seriously.

1. After completing terminal F, for international travel, many years ago. Most international flights still depart from the E and T gates. 2. While the number of gates at F are limited, there is not adequate accommodation made for arriving passengers. Instead, if arriving into an E gate and it may be on either end of the concourse, they must walk about two miles, with limited moving walkways to F gate international passport control. After all of the years that have past since completion of terminal F one would expect a solution by now. 3. Being assigned for international travel at the E gates also means you suffer the absolute chaos of dining in the central part of this concourse where, for example, there is only one coffee shop, for all of terminal E. 4. Upon exiting passport control that can be hit or miss as to ordered chaos or mayhem, one has to wait upon luggage where despite at least 6 carousels, only two may be in use, each covering several flights. This does not make any sense to me. 5. If you had done the right airport recommended parking for the international Park & Ride (the receipt says Park ATL), standby for more chaos as you exit the concourse. There are several park and ride signs on different pillars along the first pavement. However unmarked is a pillar with queuing column tape that is for white (seemingly) unmarked minibuses. These are the transport to the park and ride (that by the way should say Park ATL, same as the receipt that I paid against). 6. I can only guess that those who design, upgrade or manage ATL do not travel, themselves. International arriving passengers that arrive there are often tired, disorientated and brain fogged. Even those who have travelled through ATL extensively and live in GA, are not immune to the chaos. 7. I would not say the on site staff and ATL are rude, but they are certainly not too friendly. Returning to the US feels like the first day you report for duty in the military or I guess, arrival to start a prison sentence. This is not the America I want to project and I am sure you don't either. 8. Sadly, there is no excuse for the atrocious state of ATL and it seems that someone needs to find another career. I have little desire to fly in or out of ATL, and I do not like the airline connections from my nearest airport, here in North GA. So, if anyone from Delta is reading this, yes, it affects you too, because my wife and I will be thinking twice before we undertake the nightmare of traveling through ATL again.
Worst airport. Security lines managed so poorly, no matter how early you get in, it’s not enough. Please open more security lines. Seems the separate security lines for T-gates is no longer there.

commentHeader: lines snake through the entire airport

reviewContent: What a horrible set up for security. It took me 45 minutes to get through from the moment I walked into the terminal to getting through. Moreover, the TSA Pre signage takes you on this roundabout path through the terminal. Not being at all familiar with this airport, I asked for assistance from an airport employee to make sure I was going in the right direction, but I was met with the most rude disrespectful response and lack of customer service in my life.

One of the worst airports in the world that I have been too. Lack of terminal seating, uncleanliness. And we won’t discuss the lack of nor the disgusting bathrooms.  I will do everything I can not to fly through this horrendous airport.
TSA was impressively Rude. Atlanta always excel in rudeness and indifference.

commentHeader: worst managed airport I've ever seen
reviewContent: Probably the worst managed airport I've ever seen. Extremely long queues, confusion, rude staff. We were about to miss our connecting flight and we were given no assistance at all. I've been really surprised that such an incredibly bad organization could be found in an American airport. What about firing the management there?

Horrible airport. Good thing is that they had charging ports by the seats/on the seats. Also motion detection for trash. Everything else that matters much more - such as getting from concourse to concourse is not good. This airport is designed poorly. I’ve never had to walk so much to where I almost miss my flight due to the time it took! The team has confusing messaging - causing everyone to get off on the wrong stops - hint: the wall has the correct concourse don’t pay attention to the lights inside (or lack thereof) bc they change colors for the next stop as the door opens- causing chaos and toes to be rolled over bc everyone is worries they will miss their flights. I went directly past concourse A due to poor signage… had to hop back on and go backwards. Lastly - the doors close even if someone is in the way- I saw a guys bag almost get ripped off as the tram took off- it warned that someone was blocking the door from Closing but started driving away -scary! What if that was a child?

I travel several times a year. I went to KC MO MCI arrived on Thursday 8/10/2023 absolutely love the KC new airport so efficient and organized. Surprisingly my departure from ATL was uneventful that day. I arrived back home on Sunday 8/13/203. The train to baggage claim went to T gate, so I had to get off and walk and go up an escalator that had only 2 up escalators. The elevators weren't working. We had to then snake around to the security door on the southside and go through a glass security door. The door kept getting stuck because there are hundreds or maybe even thousands of people going through this door. The door got stuck and instead of the airport employee holding the door open she is hollering and clapping her hands and snapping her fingers like she is talking dealing with a herd of cattle, or a bunch dogs. This process of the train being down and having to walk to baggage claim seems to be the normal and not the exception. The airport workers are rude and do not offer assistance at all. When you ask for help, they are rude. On another travel experience I was leaving for Houston early morning, I was at the airport by 4 am and instead of the security checkpoint being open on the North terminal, everyone had to go through the main security terminal, thousands of people at 4-5 am and their explanation was the North terminal does not open until  5: 45. This is the most poorly run airport I have ever been to. I am afraid to invite my family and friends to visit because of the inefficiency...

commentHeader: charging ports not connected to power
reviewContent: This airport is the worst. Flight cancelled and they let us wonder around this hell hole for 15 hrs. Pushing the next flight back over and over. Then sending us back and forth between terminals and every time there we fewer and fewer seat for all the passengers Most had to stand. The charging ports were not connected to a power source. They had no where for the smokers to have a much needed cig. We would have to leave completely and start over thru TSA. I will tell everyone to avoid this airport and Delta. They just dont care for your needs. They just want the money. Its pathetic.

commentHeader: this isn't a very nice airport
reviewContent: Their oft-repeating recorded message about this airport being the busiest and most efficient in the world is only half true. Busiest? Yes. Most-efficient? No. On its own, this isn't a very nice airport. When compared to airports like Reagan National, it's downright pathetic. The workers at the vendors were okay but the TSA staff were horrible. The facilities are adequate at best. They do have some nice art but they placed it outside the secured area (i.e., if you visit it, you'll be forced to go back through the slow security lines and deal with the rude TSA agents). Plus, the art is in a very high-traffic area on the way to/from baggage claims so stopping to look at anything is going to put you in the way of people who are already unhappy because they're being subjected to the Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport. If you're stuck there overnight as I was, good luck finding food. Most of the vendors close. I was able to get food at the Burger King away from the terminals. Did I get a tasty Whopper? Nope. Burger King was out of burgers so I had to settle for something else. It wasn't very good. At least I was serenaded nearly the entire time I ate with a recorded message—Yes, they love recorded messages!—telling me that an emergency had been reported in the building and I was to stand by for further instruction (that never came).

commentHeader: every staff member was absolutely rude
reviewContent: I showed up to this airport a hour early and from the moment I checked our bag in every staff member was absolutely rude and I helped to anyone. There was a lot of confusion because none of the staff did their job. Walking through I heard many arguments between staff and random people flying and 10/10 of every argument was due to the hostility from the workers. I’ve never seen such a poorly managed airport, I showed up super early and missed my flight by two minutes. Honestly if I blame anyone it would be the staff, what a waste of a billion dollar company. It’s legit TRASH. After missing my flight I had one nice person that put us on a different plane and was very helpful and kind. She was the only one out of 20 people that I ran into. I will not be flying ever again on any flights due to my experience.

commentHeader: Worst airport ever for baggage claim
reviewContent: Security lines were good and efficient. Food options were terrible, not enough of them and lines were to long. Baggage claim takes forever. Worst airport ever for baggage claim.

Sunday June 11, 2023 at 8:30 PM or so. ATL Airport was absolute chaos, rude unhelpful staff. Had a hard time getting thru Security because they would not let get behind security to wait for early morning flight the next day in the Airport, so I could fill more safe while waiting on my flight at 06:00 AM. June 12, 2023, because there was 4 hours rule set by SWA Airlines not TSA. TSA had 12 Or 24 Hours that you could go behind Security to wait at gate until your flight Leave rule. I tried to explain to them I did not feel safe waiting outside of TSA Check in point, TSA was okay with as long as I had A Board Pass which I did finally get after I called Southwest for assistance.

I avoid this airport whenever I can! The TSA staff are consistently rude, but in August 2022, they proved to be lazy as well. I tried to show my ID to the TSA, which was greeted with a gruff "I don't need to see that! Move along!" How many other people do they say that to?

commentHeader: One of the most mismanaged, dirtiest airports
reviewContent: One of the most mismanaged, dirtiest airports. The bathrooms are nasty. Garbage overflows in the gate waiting areas as there is also trash and food all over the floors. One storm rolls through and you are shoulder to shoulder with tens of thousands of people. Then you get shuffled gate to gate through multiple changes. This little 20 minute storm causes a 7 hour delay! Restaurants and food kiosks close up and it’s 1 in the morning and no place to get food or even water for hours. They are the worst. Rude staff too. Avoid if at all possible! Oh, after multiple gates, we had to go to new concourse, but the train stopped working for the night. Long long walk.

Absolute chaos, rude unhelpful airport staff. Delays in security non functional internal transportation, over a 20 min walk to get to baggage and then a 50 min wait for hotel shuttle because they can only have 4 loading at one time. Good thing that this is no longer the worlds busiest airport. What an absolute embarrassment.

Hartsfield-Jackson airport has an unbelievable level of incompetence! Our entire experience was a nightmare. Starting from lack of parking when traveling with a blind person, to employees sleeping on the second level from the ramp from the second floor parking deck, misinformation from staff, horrible wheelchair services and not so customer friendly customer agents. Awful! And to make matters worst, when trying to voice my concerns with a rep that I was referred to, most a the conversation was dedicated to him attempting to justify with me why I was not seeing the whole picture. If I hear one more person attempt to justify incompetence by citing "Atlanta is one of the busiest airports in the world" I think I'll scream. Busy should not foster incompetence. If ever there is a vote for another entity to oversee the airport, I will vote for it! These people should be held accountable to do better.

I was hungry and just wanted a snack. The stores’ credit card machines were down so I couldn’t get the food or drink there. Then, while I was at the vending machines, they had a place to tap the card - that wasn’t working either. The train to the other concourse was very efficient and trains cam around much more often that in other airports!

I am pretty sure I have never encountered more rude people in such a short amount my of time. First we tried to get coffee at a bar (cause we wanted Baileys in it) and the lady rudely states, why don't you go to Starbucks? Then told us they didn't have coffee even though we could clearly see a fresh pot behind the bar. We proceeded to another bar, which was filthy, and sat down. We were ignored for probably 10 minutes while the sole bartender helped other people, etc. Another man came in and sat down, and she immediately waited in him, still ignoring us. On top of that, airline employees pushing wheelchairs without a care in the world who they are about the run into. You better move quickly for them or I'm pretty sure they will run you over.

Left my phone in the secure section, used my phone locator and emailed a screenshot o the Airport lost and found with my report. It sat there for three days until the battery died. No replies to any of my emails. Then this, “Despite our best efforts, your item was not found. Your case is closed.” They should all be fired for laziness, incompetence, and not doing their job.

commentHeader: security to bathrooms were so dirty
reviewContent: Filthy dirty! Every space from security to bathrooms were so dirty. Staff walking the gate areas on their phones and unable to offer assistance. Not a positive experience. On a more positive note, Delta airlines customer service was great and the gate areas provided comfortable seating and a relatively clean space for waiting.

Worst experience ever. TSA not good anyway, but this was just thuggery and shouting. Luckily, you can just stare them out - don't react! Poor transit, rude staff except the Delta desk who had to sort out accommodation. This event was purely due to staff at Atlanta. Avoid if at all possible.

Dreadful, badly signposted, poorly staffed and filthy airport. I will actively avoid flying from here in future. The signage is so bad and we could find nobody to help us. Security queue was outrageous.
Airport staff rude and unprofessional. Signs are confusing. Security lines are too long. Misguided by airport staff. Delta rep at terminal was rude. Won’t be flying to Atlanta anytime soon.

This is the most unorganized and disrespectful airport I've ever seen the TSA Staff tends to be obnoxious and overbearing with a sense of entitlement it's only job. A little common courtesy goes a long way at 5 a.m. if you don't like being up then quit by all means. I asked a gentlemen which way was ride share he said I don't know but you work here am I right i asked the young man. That was Sunday night the 26th of March on my flight from DFW to Atlanta on AA flight 2365 make no mistake I'm not sugar coating how horrible your customer service is or lack thereof. Everyone seems to be standing around and not being that so called ambassador of the busiest airport more like the laziest between texts and mindless chatter and walking around the free money must be good. My wife and I travel frequent for family and jobs so this is not my first experience at Hartsfield but I'm hoping my last so take what you will and either grow and educate or continue your pattern of turning a blind eye but it's obvious daily.

When we went to leave in the pay-to-park lot, the machines would not recognize the ticket we got when we pulled in. He tried in three different pay-exit lane machines, but they all said the ticket could not be read. Two booths were supposed to have people working in them, but neither one of them did. He pressed the help button, and an attendant came on and told us to ask someone in the booths. He told her the two booths were empty. She said, "hold on, I'll be there in a second...20 minutes later, she finally showed up and proceeded to ignore us and went over to investigate a broken gate at one of the booths instead. WE'VE BEEN SITTING HERE FOR 25 minutes now, waiting to pay to leave the airport parking lot! She took her sweet time, did a few things, screwed around on a phone call, then went into the booth and called another worker who eventually showed up and just removed the entire gate. Finally, she says, "Ok, go ahead and pay." We paid for the total amount for the four days we were parked there and finally left....40 MINUTES LATER! WHY DON'T THEY HAVE ANYONE WORKING THE EXIT GATES IN THE TWO BOOTHS AT THE PAY-TO-PARK LOT? If they did, we could have been out on the road heading home a LOT sooner! Absolutely the worst experience trying to leave!

Only sporadic signs directing arriving passengers to ground transportation. There’s obviously construction going on with missing ceiling tiles and scaffolding. Many airport staff but mostly just sitting around at 6am. No information booth. What the heck is a checkpoint? I just need to know where to catch my Uber, which turned out to be far away on the edge of a parking structure. Very disorganized and 3rd world country vibe. Only plus was that the bathroom was clean and plenty of shops were open.

Be aware, everyone is rude and feels like they do you a favour, from immigration to restaurant staff, if you not from USA then you are deemed inferior. Horrible experience and unfortunately have to do it again to see family.

Every single person we had to deal with was so rude and disrespectful. From weighing bags to security bag check. I've never felt so disrespected in my entire life. Not a single person talk to me with any type of respect.

commentHeader: Worst baggage collection and car rental experience
reviewContent: Worst baggage collection and car rental experience. This airport is a zoo and the employees are of no help. Waited nearly an hour for a little bus to take us to Hertz. Packed bus and the ride took 30 min. It was hot and several of us were getting car sick. This was after an 11 hour delayed flight from London. Avoid Atlanta Airport.

I have been through this airport many times. I dread it. Not because it’s usually busy but some of the TSA representatives are very rude. They yell at you like you are an idiot. This time it was organized well & the TSA representative who organized the line was professional. However, the TSA representative who set up people of 2 to walk passed the K9s was extremely rude and yelled at other passengers. We are made to feel like cattle or worse. Then after this experience I was yelled at by a Coffee Bean employee because I wasn’t speaking loud enough with my mask on. She had the meanest look on her face. Like I was assaulting her. If my family wasn’t living in the Atlanta area, I would avoid going to Atlanta. It’s a shame because it’s a nice city. Every airport employee needs to realize they represent their city.

I've used this airport many times. Security staff are rude. Delta staff are rude. Immigration and customs are third-world level disorganized, at least they were last time I went through them at ATL. Airport is dirty. Restrooms are dirty. Even TSA Pre-Check and CLEAR lines are very slow due to the sheer numbers of people. International terminal really isn't befitting of one. Very, very unimpressive airport. Anyone can use the excuse that they're the busiest airport in the world, but Singapore Changi, Hong Kong, Seoul Incheon, Tokyo Narita, Amsterdam Schiphol, Paris CDG, and even Detroit are much better examples of how busy airports are run and should be run. Heck, even other Delta hubs such as MSP, SLC or LGA would be a good starting point for ATL to learn some valuable lessons. Get your act together, ATL.

commentHeader: no reason to be that rude and loud
reviewContent: Had a stressful morning which was completely my fault are forgetting my purse with all my wallets and work laptop at home. I had barely made it to the security after my Uber trip back and forth trying to get my purse. At the security check I was very nervous that I was going to miss my flight hence I was rushing and had placed my stuff in one of the containers for security checked. I place it on wrong a bucket I guess since i was in different head space but darn the lady yelled at me very rudely. She was very polite in fact was even flirting with a guy standing in front of me and her whole attitude changed when it was my turn. I understand I may have placed it on a wrong place accidentally but she had no right to yell that loud in front of everyone. I even said sorry I have a flight leaving like in 10 mins and I was trying my luck. She disregarded my apologies and proceeded to yell at me loudly second time. I was shocked , because there was no reason to be that rude and loud. Everyone at the airport was very cold and rude except the waiter at the restaurants. Everyone has a day they go though but being a little nicer would make things lot easier for everybody. TSA securities I understand you guys are tired of us but there no need to be rude somethings can be said a little nicely.
The security lines are terrible. The TSA employees do not care. Does not matter if you have clear, pre check or digital ID. The lines are way too long. Even on a Sunday afternoon

ATL airport: busiest airport in the world but too busy for you. Literally running Tom Cruise style through the airport to miss my flight by 5 minutes Security line was almost 1 hour at 6am in the morning! This is ridiculous. Best my airline would do is put me on standby and maybe get another flight or pay up. Got no help from the airport or my airline. If you fly out of ATL, be warned

commentHeader: I despise having to come here
reviewContent: Over an hour to retrieve bags. Always a wait at this airport. Busiest in the world and they can’t handle it. Maybe reroute some flights to more suitable airports? I despise having to come here.

I was so pleasantly surprised by all we experienced at Atlanta going to FL and the going home to OH. The people at all Delta counters were so nice and welcoming. The restrooms were really clean and well identified. The terminal to train from T to A was immediate, clean and well directed. We then got a Dunkin Donut, coffee and ate at catCora’s kitchen. The food was very good, beautifully presented and our waiter was so nice. Thanks Atlanta!

The busiest airport in the world could sure stand to get its act together. To its credit, the signage to access the terminals from the highways and to leave the airport were, in my opinion, ample. The majority of personnel we met in that airport, even security, were polite and professional - the only reason I'm not giving this airport a completely flunking score. That includes personnel for both Delta and Frontier Airlines. The tram connecting the terminals is clean and wonderfully efficient. Some of the Delta SkyMiles lounges are national-class, even world-class. That's where my compliments end. Now here's the bad stuff: The airport is predominantly dirty (not as dirty as Denver or Seattle, but still pretty bad). There are few places to grab a bite to eat or something to drink pre-security. The baggage and ticket counters are cramped and narrow, unbecoming of the world's busiest airport. Most departure gates are also cramped and narrow, with little seating, also unbecoming of the world's busiest airport. The security lines are astonishingly inefficient, even by US large airport standards; using CLEAR and Pre-Check in tandem should take five minutes, even on a busy holiday or weekend - not 25+ minutes like it did. If you don't have an expedited security clearance like CLEAR or Pre-Check and have to wait in the normal line, 90+ minutes to get through security on the busiest of days isn't unheard of. Again, to security's credit, the TSA officers I met were nice enough, but there clearly aren't enough TSA officers staffed at ATL. And, to the credit of the thousands and thousands of passengers being herded like cattle, people behaved relatively orderly and politely. But thousands and thousands of passengers hourly shouldn't be beholden to the whims of government incompetence - which, like I've said, is unbecoming of the world's busiest airport.

commentHeader: why do they provide lousy service to their guests on later flights?
reviewContent: In coming home from visiting Colorado Springs, I arrived at Atlanta airport around 1.40am and the train that you take at the gates to get to baggage claim and ground transportation was operating on a “limited schedule.” Meaning you could wait to see when and if it would come to pick you up or walk. I was exhausted, like everyone else but we all chose to walk. Based on my activity tracker, we walked about a mile! This is not the first time this happened arriving in Atlanta late. If planes are still landing at 1.50am, why is the train not operating on the normal schedule? Atlanta airport boasts beefing the busiest and most efficient airport, why do they provide lousy service to their guests on later flights? So beware of the long walk if you arrive past their normal train running schedule!!

commentHeader: yelled at by a cleaning person
reviewContent: My wife and I found the cleaning staff, in particular late night arrival and early morning departure, were very rude and inpatient. We were yelled at on two occasions by the staff cleaning the floors near the plane train area because we were not directed by signs or staff which side of the cones we should be standing while waiting for the train. Again today, as I was arriving for an early morning flight, I was again yelled at by a cleaning person for being on the wrong side of her cones. There were no signs or persons available to direct foot traffic as to where to walk or not walk, just a red tape down the middle of the isle. Not a very good impression to greet guests arriving to such a busy airport.

I grew up with the Atlanta airport beginning and transforming. However, I am so disappointed at what it has become. The bathrooms are too small and dirty, the electrical outlets for phone charging do not work, and the attendants belong in another setting. There’s no customer service anymore. I don’t care what the pandemic has brought to America, hire people who still have integrity to get the job done

On August 20, I arrived from CDG to Atlanta on Delta 8606 Terminal 1 at 5.05 having a correspondence on Delta flight 1249 at 7.55pm to Tampa. The walk from Terminal 1 at one end of the airport to Gate A02 at the other en of the airport was for me a nightmare. No cart to be found, a 20 minute walk with luggage, no other form of transportation, barely a few escalators, up and down, up again and down again to get to a train, from the train another walk. I am 75 years of age and very fit yet I was thoroughly exhausted. I had already been through 2 customs when I arrived at the one in Atlanta to board my final flight, I had with me a few purchases bought at the Duty free airport in Paris. I had a mid size bottle of liquor which the custom agent insisted had to be put in my suitcase and my suitcase checked since apparently the duty free had forgotten to wrap it in a special plastic wrapper. Even though I had a receipt form the Duty free and a gift bag, the agent in no way educated enough to comprehend the difference, sent me back to the delta counter to open my suitcase, pack the bottle and register the suitcase. Thankfully I was lucky enough to find a gentleman at the Delta check-in who assisted me and was very kind. Admittedly from a few comments heard, I was not the first victim of the lack of understanding by the customs agents. One might say they are applying the rules, however is it applying the rules or is it enforcing the little power they have to unnecessarily harass travelers -  it is my understanding that they are continually inept at their job and take extreme pleasure in adding unpleasant and totally unnecessary steps to an already tired passenger? So between this and the lack of assistance for passengers to get from one point to the other in an immense airport, I will avoid that airport at all costs.

commentHeader: distressed by many things at the airport
reviewContent: I am distressed by many things at the airport today. The Clear and Pre Check lines are about a 30 min delay. It is hard to justify paying for these services if the line is so long. When I see supervisors at the elevated podium, I wonder why they cannot jump in to help out. When I worked, even as a manager, if we were busy I stepped in to help out. Many standing around, few working. Not all screening machines/lines are open. The food service lines are also really long. 20 min to get a cup of coffee? Why not add automated lines that deliver regular coffee to the customer? 20 min to order and deliver food to me at lunch. Again, offer more grab and go if you lack staff. The Saladworks stand is closed, as usual. One employee could sell the grab/go salads and ring up! Automate the purchase of salads like La Madeline has done. Many food vendors are still not open. Please find a way to sell pre boxed salads and sandwiches if workers are in short supply. I am happy to eat a cold salad or sandwich, hummus plate etc. Restrooms are dirty. Lots of cleaning people with their carts standing around, but they seem to be busy looking at their phones, or visiting with each other, and not cleaning. Loud music in food court at Concourse C is ridiculous. It is so loud that no one can talk, or answer phone calls from customers. Turn it down. Easy fix!

commentHeader: The airport seems to having taken a downhill turn
reviewContent: The airport seems to having taken a downhill turn as it relates to cleanliness and customer service. I feel like I’m encroaching upon peoples personal homes and spaces as I attempt to make purchases from concourse eateries (i.e. Crepes, Caribou, and Boars Head) all on concourse A. Staff seem to be plentiful but the customer service is often rude, unprofessional, and vulgar). At crepes while waiting to get my order the young lady was having a personal conversation on her phone about a side job making food. She used the “n” word often and several other vulgar words. All while waiting on me. The young ladies at Boars Head were nice but very immature. I paid $4 for a drink I ended up tossing in the trash. Speaking of trash the concourse seating area is trashy and unkept. I see cleaning carts with staff but are sitting, congregating, and on their phones. I feel like I’m in someone’s backyard uninvited. At Caribou staff appear to be disgruntled and for $6 a pop you don’t expect for them to be out of whipped cream since all pictures are featured with WC. Unfortunately, the entertainment is as trashy as the concourse. ReachTv is playing on all TVs. The profanity is used throughout the Espinosa of “magherita”. Children and adults are throughout the concourse being force to hear/see this. Surprised me that this is an international airport. If I had another choice I would take it for future travel.

Everyone here is so rude. You think with it being the busiest airport in the world they would be welcoming or helpful. Absolutely not. Everyone here rolls their eyes, gives attitude and seems to hate their job. I don’t care what time it is, you chose to do this job. I hate coming to this airport. It is not efficient at all like the mayor voice over states. It’s a joke. I hate coming here and avoid it amy time I can.

The airport is filthy. Concourse A, food seating area had so much food under the tables and the tiles had layers of grime on them. Tables had not been wiped off, gross. Concourse D gates waiting area had crusted food on the seats (old and new food); the floor did not look like it had been vacuumed in who knows when; the window and seal had dirt, food, grime splattered every where.

commentHeader: There is no welcoming in Atlanta Hartsfield Airport
reviewContent: We arrived to Atlanta late because our Delta flight left Orlando late, causing us to miss our connection and having to wait another 5 hours for the next flight to Branson MO. On our return trip through Atlanta, traveling to Orlando, we were delayed by Delta again, waiting for a flight attendant. On both our delayed layovers we experienced extremely unpleasant attitudes by both airline personnel and employees of retail establishments. Any "Welcome to Atlanta" signs should be taken down and destroyed. There is no welcoming in Atlanta Hartsfield Airport. We will avoid this airport at all cost.

commentHeader: one of the worst international terminals
reviewContent: Atlanta International Terminal is a dump. Why is the car hire only at domestic - adds an hour to an international journey. The food options at international are terrible. Tonight 9pm 26th May, most food options have run low. We are travelling business - Club ATL is a joke. No space to sit, a few chips to eat. This is one of the worst international terminals I have ever flown. And someone tells me it’s new? What a joke. Just avoid if at all possible.

The airport is dark and dingy, not clean and a nightmare to get around. This has been obvious for several years. However, their staff is even worse! I arrived from an international flight and had to wait in line for TSA clearance to get to my connecting flight. While waiting, a female airport employee responsible for assisting elderly international passengers in wheelchairs, literally was being abusive without any intervention from other employees or TSA. The passengers had been put in a side area for a while before she came in and started shouting in Spanish words to them. She didn't speak the language, only was able to shout certain words at them, and then starting cursing as she pulled them into the queue for TSA check. While getting their belongings for the TSA clearance, she was ripping things off of them (shawls, bags, hats etc.) and when one lady tried to hand her shoes for the bin, she moved aside and let them fall to the ground. Her behavior was irresponsible at best. Negligent and abusive to be accurate. She had no right to behave this way.

commentHeader: international terminal at ATL is an absolute embarrassment
reviewContent: The international terminal at ATL is an absolute embarrassment. Back in the 1990s ATL was a slick and efficient modern airport with decent facilities and efficient ground transportation. The international terminal was inadequate from new and has never been improved. 15 minute bus ride from the rental car centre is just the start of the problems. Chaotic check-in zone, unnecessary delays for security, poor food selection, poor seating. The whole thing falls a long way below modern standards. Avoid if possible.

commentHeader: the food selection could do better!
reviewContent: Good: I didn’t experience rude staff as many mentioned. I got through security quickly and everyone was fine: brisk and not overly friendly, but doing their job. Bad: Surely whoever sells the food selection could do better. One place for coffee (Starbucks) with a 50-60 person lineup. No-where else to buy coffee at 8 in the morning. One choice in breakfast food, except they didn’t have many of the choices. Otherwise there is a Chinese food place and a hamburger/hotdog place. There was one place behind bars that might open later and a sit-down restaurant, also closed, so who knows. Overall, if you have a longer connection time or your flight is delayed, fingers cross that you are not stuck in Altanta Int’l concourse.

Words almost fail me. I was transiting Atlanta on my way back to the UK from Jamaica. My duty free bottle of rum ($70 worth), sealed in a globally recognized bona-fide plastic bag, was singled out for an X-ray which it "failed". I was told to go back to the other side of security to check the bottle into hold baggage, despite my protestations that (a) it would likely get broken and (b) I therefore have to go through the whole security process again. I was then sent back to the Virgin check in desk since Delta could not process this action. Suffice to say the Virgin check in desk was not yet open. So two hours of my life wasted because the TSA X-ray machine cannot distinguish between high quality booze and something more dangerous. I still cannot decide whether this is just vindictiveness or utterly useless technology/staff. Avoid at all cost, the place is hopeless and the staff are rude beyond description.

My husband who is a regular customer of Delta and always flies the route SJO-ATL-SYR bought this expensive comfort class ticket hoping we will have a good experience. Arrived from San Jose, Costa Rica on time but had to sit in the plane for an extra 40 min because there was nobody to park the plane at the gate according to the pilot’s announcement. As a globetrotter I had never heard of such thing especially when Atlanta boasts the busiest airport and most efficient one in the world! Preposterous! My husband had requested a wheelchair on arrival and assistance. To our dismay there were no attendants at the gate. We waited until all passengers had left the sleeve and I ended up pushing the w/c through customs. We both have respiratory conditions and he has knee surgeries. The next flight to SYR was delayed, We boarded eventually and after another hour of sitting in the plane ready for take off, the pilot announced that due to storm and the crews expired time, passengers have to leave aircraft and go back to concourse A, which involves distance and riding the train. The line at the customer service was so long that it took 5 hours or 1am till 5am to finally be rebooked. Disaster airport and only three ticket agents working! As a former travel agent and world traveler, would recommend more employees and better customer service.

I will leave a couple of tips - Saturday night 3-19-2022 - 1) Airport is filthy - Carpet is horrible and not cleaned. 2) Seats are torn and look like they are from the 80's. 3) No Food or coffee available after 9? - you have Spirit Airlines here, you should think about they are never on time or late so maybe something for the disgruntled passengers something. 4) Maybe, just maybe update to the new century we live in - power and USB charging ports would be a fresh idea? Just some helpful tips for you!

commentHeader: As everyone has repeated they are rude
reviewContent: As everyone has repeated they are rude, and give unnecessarily contradictory and complicated instructions. For example, at the check in 3/4 at 6.50 am I was told to walk forward and simultaneously push my items through on a backed up overflowing conveyor belt. I asked the female agent to clarify which she wants me to do she tells me to push my items forward. How on an overflowing conveyor belt as you are also yelling at me to go through the metal detector? Her response was a condescending “make it make sense” as if the passengers were too stupid to understand. Atlanta and Miami are always the worse with Atlanta far exceeding Miami. I know it won’t get better because this is how it’s been. I wish TSA would improve its hiring and training.

What an embarrassment for a supposedly premier international airport. 2 TSA agents essentially unmasked (masks under chin) despite federal mandate, TSA agents extremely rude and aggressive. All food options closed by 8pm. Really - does the person responsible for running this place really not have a clue how poorly run and embarrassing this airport is?

We arrived as a connection to our international trip around 8 pm, expecting that we’ll be able to eat dinner before boarding our 11 pm flight to Paris. Every single restaurant and food place in the F terminal (where I believe all international flights happen) were closed. Every single one. We were gobsmacked. Upon our return home, we had another connection through ATL. Customs line was horrifically long and the security lines to our connecting flight were awful. Our first flight was delayed, but despite that, we still had two hours to get to our connecting flight, and we still missed it. Complete disorganization and mayhem. Spent the night in Atlanta.

commentHeader: Embarrassing that this is a premier airport
reviewContent: Arrived on KLM/Delta from Amsterdam. The transition from the international to domestic terminals is awful and confusing with only rude help available at the scene. What were the designers thinking with whether no or confusing signage and a mostly unmarked maize to get from baggage recheck from Intl to domestic gates. Embarrassing that this is a premier airport. Very sad. Will avoid in the future.

commentHeader: Food, and trash on chairs and floor
reviewContent: Disgusting. I got stuck over night on 12/26/21. The area for my Delta flight was disgusting. Food, and trash on chairs and floor. It was obvious it was not being cleaned let alone sanitized, four days later and I’m in line for a Covid test. Thanks!

Aggressive, rude TSAs. My sister has sleep apnoea, to breathe at night, she must carry a CPAP machine. She has asthma, she needs a special inhaler. Her bag was pulled aside not once, nor twice, her bag was detained 'three times'. The TSA agents opened her bag, removed the CPAP machine, and failed to recognize the secondary inhaler machine as another appliance that needed to be scanned separately. Unprofessional and a waste of time. My sister was glared at, accused of being difficult, and treated with such distain and rudeness that her anxiety (for which she is on medication) spiked. Badly. It has been several hours since then, and she is still near tears when she describes her experience. An agent held his hand up in her face to cut her off when she tried to speak to him, and was spoken to both sharply and aggressively when she tried to cooperate. On top of all that, when her bags were thrown in bins to be rescanned, her brand-new neck pillow was jostled loose. Additionally, there was a forgotten black-and-red laptop that sat where it was for over 10 minutes. My sister's medical equipment got scanned three times, but nobody noticed an abandoned device for almost a quarter of an hour? Is this negligence or ignorance? The experience was disgraceful. Unprofessional is too kind a description for the treatment my sister endured.

This airport is genuinely insufferable. If you book a flight at 6, you might as well be prepared to leave at 10 and sit in a chair for hours. I am a frequent flyer here and I have never once had a flight that didn't have a major screw-up or set back. One would assume operating an airport would constitute having functional facilities and airplanes but Atlanta Hartsfield does things differently. I almost never write reviews for anything but Hartsfield has burnt me so many times that I felt like warning anyone curious. I'm nauseated with paying hundreds of dollars to leave at a specified time and quite literally never once having my end of the deal held up. If you have options, weigh them well.

commentHeader: there were very few people working
reviewContent: Arrived from the UK on 2nd December. Despite there only being less than a hundred people or so in the queue it took over an hour to get through passport control as there were very few people working. Only one kiosk was going through passengers with special assistance/in wheelchairs and as such there was a queue of over ten people in wheelchairs waiting, I hope none of them became unwell during this time. On our return we were very surprised that in F/international terminal all food outlets closed at 7pm, considering most flights heading East depart later in the evening and at night time this hardly makes a lot of sense. This information isn't even on the website so we couldn't prepare and eat in advance.

commentHeader: I have never had such a poor experience at an airport
reviewContent: The airport is very chaotic beginning with my son having to let me out in the middle of the street due to no traffic directing for departure. I have been flying Delta and a skymiles member preferring Delta due to their quality customer service until I had the most rude and disrespectful Delta agent at the luggage check in. She was very impatient barking orders for me to scan my boarding pass and not giving me time to comply before barking another order what's my name she was so impatient. I have severe arthritis and it takes me awhile to use my hands due to stiffness and lost of feeling in my fingers. I handed her my ID as the scanner did not appear to be working. She was sucking her teeth and rolling her eyes it was so uncomfortable dealing with her attitude. I ask could I check my other bag if the flight was full instead of at the gate again due to disability of having to take bags to the gate. She then saw I had my 4 lbs yorkie in her carrier and stated is that an animal. I told her yes she is a dog, I was accused of trying to sneak the dog past her. She would not allow me talk at all. I finally asked for another agent to assist me while she continued to speak to me defensively. Finally another agent come over and took care of me while she continued to fuss in front of him. I asked her please stop speaking to me you are very rude and unprofessional. She threatened to not let me on the flight. I asked why because your being rude I have never had such a poor experience at an airport. I paid the pet fee and thanked the gentleman for helping me. He was very professional. Once I went through security with my pet. The agent that tested my hands was rude and yelled at me because I set my dog down on the counter to prevent from dropping her as he asked for my other hand. Yelled at me to don't put the dog on the counter as if she had rabies. She is a 4lb yorkie. I said sorry please don't yell at me I'm trying not to drop my dog. He was very rough with swabbing my hand and dismissive. I rarely write reviews but I have to let Atlanta know you need to do better. Not coming back through anytime soon. I will also be making complaint to Delta regarding treatment of passengers with disabilities need extra time to preform request. Different airports have different requirements so more signage directions should be visible.

My Son and I had a 4 hour layover, found our gate and parked it right there. We spent much of the 4 hours chatting with the "nice" lady behind the counter and when it came close to the time we thought we should get a seat assignment to Charleston, she stated she needed to board a flight to PA and then she would get us our seat assignments. She boarded the first flight and then left. Another agent came up and we asked him if we could get the seat assignment and he stated that the gate changed 15 minutes prior. We ran to the gate (which was about 4 up from where we were) and they closed the doors and we "missed" the flight. We then needed to find another flight but I was hot. No one was accountable just repeatedly stating that we need to watch the monitors as it was our responsibility. Yes. I 100% agree if I hadn't been in almost constant communication with the lady who stated she would be the one to help. Everyone I talked to was rude and lacked any kind of empathy or accountability. If one more person stated that "We change gates all the time, you need to watch the monitors" I thought my head would explode. Whatever happened to common courtesy, or better yet, common sense? Why would I stare at a screen if the lady behind the desk stated she was the one to check us in? We lost an entire day of work and the expense was huge. Thank goodness for that free drink voucher.

commentHeader: The lines were very very long
reviewContent: What happened to this airport? I used to rave about this before, being one of my most favorites in the world. I travel extensively and I always prefer ATL as my port of entry. But I think after the bad experience I had today, I will be looking for another POE. The Immigration had a very long line. But I breezed through that line in less than 10 minutes. Luggage claim and rechecked no problem. After recheck, passengers were about to go through security when we were all redirected to the TSA line upstairs. This was where the mess all started. The lines were very very long, and were hardly moving. There were a few times when the lines just stopped. The smart move would have been to open more metal detectors to get the lines moving, instead the TSA officers were just standing around. They only had three conveyors/detectors opened. Why? This airport was so much better than this. Today was a major disappointment. As a result, I missed my connecting flight to Orlando. And vowed to never fly into this airport again if I could help it.

commentHeader: Worst lost and found experience I ever had
reviewContent: Worst lost and found experience I ever had, my phone tracker said the phone was in the lost and found and they are saying they cant find it. Also second lost and found but no way of contacting them or to go about reporting my item lost, I was just told to check the other one, why have two separate lost and founds in one airport with separate numbers and ways of reporting. They don't talk to each other and when you report it the site doesn't tell you which lost and found to contact.

commentHeader: hope many others boycott the vendors
reviewContent: Most vendors no longer accept cash in this airport. Debit or credit card or no food or drink. How discriminating - some people including kids do not have a card. What happened to the dollar being legal tender? I will not buy anything in this airport! I hope many others boycott the vendors so they can go out of business.

commentHeader: watched all aspects of the airport decline
