There is no distinction between US Citizens and foreigners who all are forced to stand and wait in the same lines. The red jacketed attendant stupidly replied to me that this was a better system, that the signs for USCitizens did not mean anything, and that no one was superior with this system. This insulted me for several reasons. 1) All foreign destinations have lines for citizens and another line for non-citizens. The citizens lines tend to move rapidly. 2) I am a Vietnam Vet, a US Citizen, a taxpayer and feel we should have priority entering our own country. As it was, we waited in line for 2 hours, and after the fingerprint scanner failed, the Officer simply got up from his desk, closed the door and walked off the floor. If this was a private business, he would have been fired.

TSA rude and unhelpful. Barking orders as loudly as possible and all the time the same orders as though it was a meat processing plant. We were told we were TSA Approved and it was on our pass for boarding - we were told to tell the staff member which we did. It seemed to make them want to search for a problem even more. They ridiculed my plastic boots given to all passengers in Madrid to keep their feet or socks clean when they remove shoes, and they were so rude and told me it was not acceptable after I had cleared the machine - shoes removed because of big heals. There was zero in my tiny case other than clothes but they held it back and kept it for so long another passenger intervened and told them to give it to me, and they had just left it sitting behind the the x ray box and had not done anything with it after the screening there! They then proceeded to try to close it and were catching the clothes in the zipper which seemed to amuse the man doing it. We asked for it back to close ourselves, before something was torn. This is about the third trip through this airport and we will never return to the airports [or city]. The flight to Seattle from Virgin was delayed three times and the the third time it was then backtracked upon and we were told - by a soft human voice and no inter-com it was "going right now". By then many people had walked right away from the gate to fill the three hours projected wait from the last delay: somewhere other than the boring gate area. People crowded around frantic to get on, and there was only an elderly staff member half directing who was boarding in a quiet voice with no inter-com. It was a total gong show, unbelievable. No cabin staff around other than at the door, and suitcases being stuffed into bins overhead where half would literally not fit! Swap out most of the staff to Seatac for two weeks and show them some manners and common sense tactics. Maybe La Guardia is better?? NJ certainly is not! I am a well travelled 72 year old, and this airport is the worst of the worst. Pay staff properly and get some fresh faces, not control freaks!

commentHeader: would not return to this airport by choice
reviewContent: The terminals are so poorly organized and so are all the queues and checkpoints. The staff in security and even in restaurants were either unhelpful, rude, uninterested, or spoke to people very poorly, as if we are to blame for how unorganized they are? I have read numerous other negative reviews now and would not return to this airport by choice ever again. I hope someone higher up decides to take more pride in this establishment because it’s embarassing how awful our and others’ experiences have been. I would never recommend this airport to anyone.

commentHeader: you always have to wait forever"
reviewContent: JFK is the worst airport to have to get your bags at. Whenever I travel in Europe or another state you get off the plane and your bags arrive shortly after. At JFK you always have to wait forever and for no good reason. There is no consideration for passengers especially late at night. They should be embarrassed with their poor service everytime!

For an airport that has been established for so long, I could not believe at how disorganised it all was. You guys need to learn a few manners, try fellow Americans at Walt Disney world, they'd teach you a thing or two. Security staff were by far the worst here, very unprofessional, rude and unhelpful. Good luck to whoever is in charge of this disorganised team, you're definitely going to need it. You need to have a star rating for security/immigration, if there was, I'd struggle to award any star rating.

commentHeader: was hoping for a speedy transit
reviewContent: Well after an eleven hour flight and not feeling too well - I was hoping for a speedy transit through customs (I was travelling with hand luggage only). Once I got into the customs hall reality hit - 1.5 hours waiting in line with hundreds maybe even thousands of other passengers to get processed. Heres the thing - they have 60 desks - 3 of which were manned. The whole feeling there was one of absoloute disdain for the passengers experience. Avoid this airport - find another route unless you like standing bored senseless as a first taste of America.

I won't be going near this airport ever again, I have never ever experienced such poor treatment,  rudeness, laziness and gruesome attitude of staff that obviously think they are superior to all of us passengers. I hardly managed to catch my flight because of long queues, and because instead of following the signs and going into separate lines, all of us had to go in one line. Machines are not working properly, there is no one to show you what to do, and when you finally fight your way through crazed passengers and arrive to the officer in charge who will check your passport, you get a terrible treatment. Unfortunately, no one will care about all these negative reviews and about all our frustrations, until we all stop flying to and via NYC. Considering the number of people in the world, this will never happen, but I sincerely hope that someone will make a big deal out of it, someone important who will be treated like this and put a stop to all incompetent and miserable people who work there. Such an amazing city, but when you arrive it makes you never want to visit it again. Not even in transit.

Horrific experience. I am not sure why, but the staff here think they are far superior to any passenger! We were treated terribly on arrival to the airport, with staff either ignoring us when we asked questions about which ESTA lane to join or they simply shouted their robotic “all first time ESTAs this way” in our faces. Both of us had been to the USA previously, so we joined the “returning ESTA” line, but apparently if you haven’t been within the last 2 years you have to join the “first time ESTA” line? Had the rude staff member we approached explained this it would have been quite simple. Then on departure the man at security was simply inhuman. Screeming at people to step inside a security screen and then barking orders like “don’t you dare move a muscle”, “are you blind?”. I understand the need for strict security with all that has happened in recent years, and I can appreciate the need for staff to be formal and professional, but that is not what this was. There was a complete disregard for maintaining the respect and dignity of passengers. There is absolutely no need to speak to people in such a manner, these people need to be taught some manners and get off their high horses. I won’t be flying into America again for this reason. I’d rather explore all of the other wonderful places in the world that treat other people with dignity and respect. The cleanliness of the airport was also an issue. With smelly toilets that were consistently out of loo paper and sticky seats and tables.

It was my 3rd visit to JFK and my daughters 1st. Each visit the process of going through immigration and security gets worse. On arrival from Heathrow it was clear to some of the staff at JFK that a few of us weren't sure where we had to go. When we approached staff we were either ignored, tutted at or laughed at. One member of staff was sniggering at a family struggling to use the self check in machines. It was chaotic. However at the end of our trip when we returned to JFK well what can I say. TSA service was disgusting. The only thing missing was a cattle prod. Shouting orders, humiliating people, talking to us like we were animals. I have never in my life experienced another human being talking to any member of the public like this. There was no need for it. Many people were visibly upset and uncomfortable. It upset myself and my daughter. I will never ever return to America again. It has totally put me off forever. I would also recommend friends and family to avoid JFK at all costs. That is unless they want to be treated like a prisoner. It was so nice to get home to Britain.

After entering the airport, everything was going well until we came across the TSA checkpoint. This is the first tsa checkpoint I have encountered with the most rude and unprofessional personnel in my thirty years of traveling around the world. The superiors of the tsa personnel need to go under cover and see for themselves what a nightmare JFK airport really is. The tsa employees were inconsiderate, rude, and words cannot describe their unprofessionalism. Not only was my family affected by their actions, but everyone in the same line. Never ever go to this airport, until they clean up the tsa's act! Other than the tsa, everything was fine.

My boyfriend and I were travelling to Cancun from Heathrow via New York JFK. The booking allowed for 3.5 hours between flights which we assumed would be sufficient. In fairness to the airport there had been heavy snow the day before but when we arrived and went to baggage reclaim, it took 2 hours for the bags to come through, my bag came through on a different carousel! It was sheer luck I overheard another passenger telling someone that I found my bag at all. We deposited them with the Baggage Transfer Desk and ran to catch our flight which was, fortunately for us, delayed anyway. The staff there were surly, unhelpful and rude, no appreciation of our dilemma at all. We arrived at Cancun to find out our baggage had not arrived and in fact it took 3 days to turn up, we were very stressed and ended up having to go shopping for clothes and other items which we could barely fit in our luggage. On our return, everything ran very smoothly, arrived in time, quickly retrieved our luggage, passed it to Baggage Transfer and got on our flight without any problems back to Heathrow. Unbelievably only one of our bags turned up, we are still waiting for the other one which was delayed for reasons unknown in JFK. I will never ever go via this airport again, I will either find another route or not bother than go through this misery. If it wasn't for my boyfriend's and I determination to make the best of a bad situation, it would have totally destroyed out first long distance holiday together. Avoid this airport at all costs.

This airport is really poor in handling the air traffic let alone the ground traffic. I arrived from Cairo and left a 3.5 hour transit time. The immigration queues are massive and once you pass immigration you have go to baggage claim. You need to buy a trolley for $6, god help you if you manage to find one, let alone if you don't have dollars. Unfortunately the airport staff are not helpful and aggressive and make you feel you are not to approach or bother them. In transit you need to claim baggage first if you arrival in terminal 4, its chaotic getting out and trying to find your terminal departure or connecting flight - very crowded. I would honestly try to plan to avoid arriving in JFK. The departure hall in terminal 4 is really nice with a lot of amenities and services, if you have the luxury of time, however even with a 3.5 hour transit time I thought that was enough, I was wrong.

commentHeader: No excuse for an airport of this magnitude
reviewContent: It was a horrible experience! First we kept getting delayed because of the plane leaving JFK to get to us. 5 hour delay which cost us an extra $150 in lunch and drinks at the airport for four of us. We finally board, and land at JFK only to be told we don't have a gate! Sat there for almost 3 hours, pull up to a gate and no one to direct the pilot all the way in. 15 min wait for that! So glad that we didn't have bags checked in! I'm now sick because of being up for 24 hours. My youngest son had to drive back to college that same day. Should have been home by 9.30 Saturday night instead of 5.30 am Sunday. Felt bad for the flight crew, they were completely spent from being on the previous flight also. No excuse for an airport of this magnitude!

Never in my life, as an adult or child, have I ever experienced being spoken to in the way I was at JFK airport. Every member of staff I came into contact with was disinterested in their tasks, rude, careless and irritated. At customs I was shouted at by members of staff and when making a mistake with which way to line up I was humiliated by staff who laughed at me and questioned me in the most patronising way about why I had gone one way and not another. Once through customs I burst into tears after such an unnecessary and upsetting ordeal. The staff at JFK are absolutely the rudest people I have ever met. I cannot understand why they are allowed to behave like that. I will avoid this airport at all costs in future and will be reluctant to visit NYC. Disgraceful. Manners are free, a smile is easier than a frown and belittling others is not an acceptable form of ‘crowd control’. Playground bullies.

Landed at New York JFK late from the Dominican Republic. JFK airport knew of our late arrival 4 hours in advance. We landed at 11.50 pm and we are still waiting on the plane, which is now 2.00 am and no word about them getting us off anytime soon. Just been sitting here for the last two hours! I hate JFK airport, they are so unorganized!

commentHeader: JFK airport you have to pull it together
reviewContent: Returned from London to New York, after an 8 hour flight we had to stay inside the airplane for 4 more hours since JFK had no place for us to unboard, terrible situation for any traveler. When we finally unboarded at 3.30 am the airplane, we went to immigration where we encountered a severely overcrowded area with passengers and under staffed by immigration officers trying to cope, that took us about 2 hours more. JFK airport you have to pull it together, very disorganized and unfriendly place to be.

commentHeader: not a great start to a holiday
reviewContent: A horrible experience, disorganised, rude staff and not a great start to a holiday. Customs people were rude and sorry, job or not, manners are a must for anyone. Sorry USA but you don’t offer great customer service.

After having a lovely week visiting New York our last experience left a bitter taste in our mouths. The staff at the departure gates, (flight no EI0108, December 6 at 21.10) were downright rude! I can’t understand why these people work with the public, they have no people skills whatsoever. They were very obviously never taught any manners or customer service skills and they must have no one supervising them.The way they spoke at (yes spoke at, not to) people queuing up made my blood boil and I could see a number of people extremely annoyed by their behaviour. Would not recommend this airport to anyone and will be avoiding in the future.

Arrived from Barcelona on T4. If you have kids and need a luggage cart after customs, they charge you $6 for the short trip out the doors. You also have to walk out of the secure area if you just connect. TSA does not care if you have kids with stroller. Narrow waiting lines do not make it easy either.

I had to date this as happening in December 2016 but the actual date was September 2016. On arrival I was in a wheelchair and was shouted at because it seemed the hand scanner was not successful in scanning my hand, after 3 attempts he shouted, 'What have you got on your hands'. What can you say. I didn't know why it didn't work. He tried again, still nothing. So then he starts shouting at me to go to a different scanner. It appeared it was all my fault that it didn't work. The second scanner was successful on the second attempt. It was all done in a horrible uncaring manner and I have to say I was beginning to regret traveling to New York at all. The immigration official was so miserable and rude I felt I was totally not welcome in the country. When leaving New York it was even worse. I was in a wheelchair again and was shouted at to go this way and that way. I then underwent an intensive search in public. The wheelchair was scanned and that belonged to the airport. When he was finished I was told that I was sitting in the wheelchair with my legs apart and that looked suspicious. I suppose that and the fact that my body was shaking because I have Parkinson's made me a potential criminal at 73 years old. I wouldn't have minded so much if they didn't talk to me as if I was already guilty commiting a crime. They are rude, unsympathetic and downright nasty without cause and I will not be going back there again.

The airport security was absolutely horrible. There is nobody giving directions on getting through security check. Most airports have you take off your shoes, place coats on belt, etc. Not JFK. They make their own rules. They don’t tell people what to do, they scream. I understand NY has tight security, but there’s no reason to scream violently at passengers trying to catch their flights. Absolutely worst experience ever. From now on I’ll be avoiding JFK at all costs.

When booking my travel, I go out of my way to avoid JFK airport. Besides the expected hour long wait on the runway before take off, that every flight experiences, the terminal is a nightmare. TSA employees are always very unprofessional. The person who takes your ticket at a movie theater behaves better than these people. The employees at the resturausnts would rather you "go over there" for food, instead of you sitting at their restaurant. Food is terrible, atmosphere is terrible, people are miserable, WiFi never works right. Next time I fly to DC, I am absolutely going to fly through either ATL or DET. The longer flights from Boston is much much better than dealing with the the headaches that come with JFK.

Awful, awful terminal. Noisy, small, crowded. Nowhere decent to eat, very little choice. Small convenience stores, long queues. Totally inadequate charging facilities for devices - 10 to each gate in a block, not at seats. Poor WiFi, only 30 minutes free. None of the escalators were working. Lift slow and small, could barely cope with one trolley. Poor shopping. No computer or camera outlets. Just awful, expected JDK to world class but I will go a long way to avoid flying there again.

commentHeader: an embarrassment for such a major city
reviewContent: JFK is the absolute worst airport in the world and I have been in most of them as I travel globally often. It is dirty, and very third world - it is an embarrassment for such a major city. All the airport staff are horrible and incredibly rude. I usually fly out of JFK for the convenience but it’s not worth it, better not by much, to go to Newark. As an American and a New Yorker it is a disgrace. you get what you pay for JFK.

Terminal 7 is shocking to say the least. A complete lack of seating is available which is not helpful at all when travelling with elderly relatives. There were no customer assistants or staff to direct or help. The air con was broken or does not exist but the temperature was far too hot and unacceptable. The wandering tiki was over run with people due to lack of seating in the terminal or at the gates. Just trying to get a drink was an ordeal in itself. The staff however were friendly but evidently unable to keep up with demand. The long island brew house was put of action however even with this I do not feel this would have helped the seating situation. People were literally laying all over the floor. I can guarantee I will be paying extra to fly in and out of Newark.

Worst airport ever. As an American, I feel ashamed that there are people from other nationalities coming and going from this airport daily and experiencing the downright dehumanizing rudeness from its employees. Despite just getting off an 11 hour flight and a three hour one before that, I was in a good mood, until I arrived here. The immigration line was long and horrible when arriving. The place is filthy and the food selections are downright terrible. When I checked my luggage in, the clerk was extremely rude straight away and acted bothered by nothing. TSA both coming and going were unprofessional with horrible attitudes whose only real profession seemed to be making snide comments for extremely petty reasons. Everywhere I went there were long lines of people being herded along like cattle by some rude staff member. I have to wonder, is it in these people's job descriptions to be blatantly rude? I will do what I need to never use this airport again, even if that means paying more for a ticket elsewhere.

This has to be the worst airport ever. The staff were vile and aggressive. Myself and my daughter were shouted at for walking to the wrong line, a line that another employee had told us to join. This is what she shouted verbatim - 'Hello maam, Hello am I not here? Are you blind? Are you just going to ignore my instruction?' To which I replied of course not, it was obvious that she wasn't interested in what her colleague has said. This was a bully who was on a power trip. We stood in line and watched as she continued to belittle others, absolutely disgusting behaviour.

Unnecessarily rude, airport is unorganised, shops are overpriced and nowhere to sit. I hope I never have to fly to this airport again. The only good thing about the airport was the air train which was pretty efficient but, apart from that my experience was terrible.

Quite double experience with JFK airport. T4 is ok, but nothing outstanding. The CBP clearance during arrival was very chaotic. Officers/personnel pointing you in the wrong direction. The baggage was taken from the belt and put together on the ground due to a lack of sufficient amounts of reclaim belts. Departure was smooth. No long waiting times in the DL Priority area, curbside very crowded. TSA not that bad, only 10 mins or so. But the waiting areas around the gates were very crowded. I was happy that I was able to acces the DL Skyclub to avoid all those people and crying children. Duty-free very overpriced and limited shopping.

commentHeader: New York JFK Airport customer review
reviewContent: TSA staff at Terminal 7 were extremely rude, perhaps the worst I've ever encountered. They literally bark at you, offering no assistance if you look like you're struggling. My husband forgot his wedding ring after leaving security, when he went back to get it the TSA officer was disgustingly rude. My husband is not one to back down so he gave him a piece of his mind. Nevertheless, it was a horrible experience. You can be firm and polite, there is absolutely no excuse for such rudeness.

commentHeader: an extremely long walk to US Customs
reviewContent: When I arrived in New York's JFK Airport, it was an extremely long walk to US Customs. Once I arrived at customs there were two very long lines. Since I was a US citizen, I was able to get on the shorter line. I had to use electronic kiosks and then was redirected to a long line. But luckily, there were plenty Customs Officers on duty so I was able to get through in about 20 minutes. Baggage claim wasn't too bad and taxi dispatch got me a taxi really quickly.

Horrible System! Arrived at 11am didn't get out until 12:49 pm. 2 hours. Very inefficient system of scattered scanners, people having difficulty and staff refusing to help people. Then you wait in a disorganized line for customs control. Asked me if I brought anything and I replied that I didn't bring food whereby he rudely lashed out "that's not what I asked you". This is no way to be welcomed back to the United States regardless of being citizen or not. We are supposed to be a leader in technology and friendly country yet first impressions by every face I saw was one of misery, fear of complaining and disappointment. Luggage area has videos playing yet no info on which flight suitcases are coming from. Very disappointing.

commentHeader: I must have entered another dimension
reviewContent: I arrived at JFK for the first time in four years in June 2017. The immigration checkpoint had changed by then, with everyone required to scan his/her passport at a computer kiosk. Fortunately, an airport employee was nice enough to show me where to stand to take my picture. The Homeland Security official who checked my passport and customs declaration form (6059B) didn't stamp it. After retrieving my luggage and queuing up to submit the 6059B, an armed customs officer brusquely asked me why I'd gotten in line. I told him that I was waiting to submit the form and he rhetorically asked if he'd told me to get in line. So I left the queue and exited the terminal. Thankfully, that was the only bad treatment I got at JFK during this trip. Two months later, when I departed New York, security at its Terminal 1 was surprisingly streamlined. TSA didn't require passengers to take off their shoes, produce their laptops, or receive a body scan/patdown. I must have entered another dimension.

I used to like Terminal One at JFK. No so, this time. The TSA agents were beyond rude. They were shouting (barking) orders at the people on the line as if they were drill sergeants. If someone left something in his or her pocket they insulted him and yelled that he's holding up the line. When someone is screaming at you at the top of his lungs, it's hard to comprehend and follow his instructions. I have been to airports all over the world and do occasionally make a mistake. I have found that everywhere else, the agents are polite and usually friendly. These people need serious retraining and should be let go if they can't behave like humans.

commentHeader: I was in a good mood before I got to this place
reviewContent: Rudest staff I have ever encountered at an airport or any place of business for that matter. I don't fly often so I was not familiar with the kiosk check in. It asked for my confirmation number, I did not know where to find it on my voucher (it was called something different on the voucher) so I asked a floor staff member for help. I asked how to use the kiosk and she replied, "what's hard about it? Do you know how to read? All you have to do is read!" Her tone was demeaning and she kept walking as she was speaking to me. TSA agents were basically rude robots getting easily frustrated over nothing. Even the lady working at the small convenience store near gate #32 was extremely rude when a price was not clear on an item. I was in a good mood before I got to this place.

The passport control employees at immigration control are beyond horrible and rude. Most of them around the entry queues can barely speak English. They all have very bad attitudes and will offer no help. If you go through there, be sure to take your blood pressure medication beforehand.

Horrible staff, who are not willing to help anyone and speak very rudely. My flight was delayed 3 hours, and not once was anyone in the slightest bit apologetic, and when I asked how much longer it would be and politely mentioned I had been traveling for 22 hours and was deeply tired they said to me 'oh well that's not our fault is it'. Only nice person I spoke to at JFK was the man at customs when I arrived.

commentHeader: there was no help at all
reviewContent: I've never experienced an airport with ruder staff, from the staff scanning to the customs staff to the McDonalds staff. Not a smile, not a conversation. It was my partner and I's first time in America and there was no help at all to make the situation any easier.

commentHeader: good collection of shops and restaurants
reviewContent: I used Terminal 1 for our recent trip. On the outbound journey, the security check lines were long but moved rapidly. The terminal is used by a large number of airlines. It has a good collection of shops and restaurants. The Alitalia lounge was spacious and airy with a good selection of self servings of finger food and drinks including beer from Italy. It also offered free wifi and an announcement was made when our flight was ready to board. On return, we used the automatic kiosks for our passports. The exit was a breeze. The officers were pleasant and we were out of the terminal in no time. In sum, it was a hitch free experience considering the number of passengers and flights that as handled by this terminal.

commentHeader: the rudest agents I have ever encountered
reviewContent: The TSA agents at JFK are the rudest agents I have ever encountered. Several of them were shamelessly shouting at passengers undergoing security screening. Others simply didn't deign to speak to passengers. My partner was retrieving his things after they had been scanned, and he was apparently in one officer's way. Instead of saying "excuse me" like a decent person, she stood directly behind him until he noticed her, and then she made the "shoo" hand gesture at him. From one adult to another! It's honestly appalling. Additionally, Terminal 7 doesn't have enough seating, and I have located exactly six outlets (that work - I found two others that did not work) in the Gates 1-6 section. And I don't mean six pairs, I mean three pairs.

It took two hours from arrival at the gate at New York JFK Airport to pick up my luggage. Incredibly slow immigration process once again. It rivals the arrivals process at MIA. Passengers with connecting flights should be warned to allow at least three hours between flights, not the two hours or even less posted by the airlines. An incredibly stressful process.

commentHeader: not a great start to our stay
we couldn't take the cart in
reviewContent: Got to international entry from France and picked up our luggage to go through customs, the carts were there and the cost was $6. Less than 50 feet later, we were told we couldn't take the cart in. That is absolutely wrong! There was no sign saying that you couldn't take it. The airport was so hot, the hike to the gate was ridiculously long without the cart. After an overseas flight, it is ridiculous to not provide some kind of cart to go to the gate.

Shocking customer service. The terminal transfer train comes every 15 to 20 minutes! I sat and watched as the cleaner moved 3 customers who were in the middle of their meals so he could rearrange the tables. I then tried to get a coffee in the only coffee shop open in the entire terminal (it's 9.47 pm) only to be told they wouldn't serve me because they are closing, in 15 minutes. So far, that attitude of every staff member has been that they simply couldn't care less. The management needs some serious addressing to have allowed the staff to get away with such poor performance.

On arriving into New York JFK we headed for the nightmare of passing through immigration. We joined the conga line in about 300th place and the queue did not move for ages. Looking around I could see 2 officers in booths. This is ridiculous, by now the line had extended to crazy proportions and there must have been 1500 people some with very young children crying through tiredness and hunger. We were given no reason for this delay and were not given any water at all. It took us nearly 4hrs from plane to leaving. I think this needs looking at very seriously. I suffer from diabetes and this made me feel dreadful through lack of food and water and ruined my first day in a wonderful country.

commentHeader: no explanation or apology was made
reviewContent: I have used this airport many times, where I have generally not had a bad experience. But after my recent trip to New York, passing through JFK, I am left feeling saddened by my observation that something has gone very wrong with this airports ability to provide a decent level of customer service. My arrival process involved myself and other customers being left standing in a line, not moving, for a considerable length of time, looking at empty immigration desks. Also the self service pass port check machines were not available. No explanation or apology was made for a very obvious problem. Some public announcement was made, worded in a way that only airport staff could understand, immigration officers made their way to their desks, we were then processed reasonably quickly. It was during my departure when I experienced similar issues already explained in other bad reviews for this airport, regarding security staff. I am left disgusted by the total lack of professionalism and any kind of courtesy or respect from your staff during the security process. I shared my concern with a member of staff at the Information Desk (with the understanding that it was not within her jurisdiction) who's response made it clear to me that she felt I was overreacting. I am left feeling that the management of JFK Airport have no understanding or just don't care that their airport staff are giving their customers such a vile experience. I don't feel comfortable to give JFK Airport my custom again.

commentHeader: No signs, no info, no help
reviewContent: I have traveled the world and JFK is the winner for lack of signage, lack of people that help or know anything about the airport they work in. I am a seasoned traveler arrived at terminal 2 to go to terminal 4. No signs, no info, no help for luggage. I had to go outside, cross the road find the air train to get to terminal 4. Then the tea agent toget into security area to renovate was rude and when I asked a question was even more rude. I have never had this treatment anywhere but JFK. The lines for security are very long, I couldn't find the end of the line because they appear to be clumped together. Needless to say avoid at all costs. This place is an embarrassment

I had a 6:25am flight but misjudged the travel time on the train as I forgot all the trains run local overnight. I arrive shortly before 6am and see a long security line so I realize I am unlikely to make my flight. It's my fault so I realize I have to accept my fate. But once they scanned my ticket, a TSA worker asks who is boarding the flight. I raise my hand and they make sure I get through the security line and tell me to run towards the gate. I run to the gate with my bag and the airline staff usher me on board, as I'm the last to arrive before the doors close. I am so thankful I made my flight! JFK gets some poor reviews and I've had less than stellar experiences there but this one restores my faith in JFK staff. They have to put up with a lot and I really appreciated them helping me make my flight.

commentHeader: Giving this airport a 1 is being kind
reviewContent: Is 0 an option? Giving this airport a 1 is being kind. Every time I go through it is delayed getting to the gate or taking off. This is not due to the airlines but the airport not managing traffic. Getting from one terminal to another is a joke and I have missed flights waiting on the Busses to move. Avoid this airport at all cost.

New York JFK is probably the worst airport I have ever been to and I have been to many. Staff are horrible. There is no real method to lining up to go through security it just seems like a mess. They keep telling you not to block the areas but there is nowhere for people to go. Immigration is a shambles, the machines are good but again there is no real methodology to lining up. It says go to a machine when the lights are green but there are about 100 machines, half of which you can't see from the line. I was at gate C68 and assumed I had plenty of time when I followed the signs but no, without warning it told me I had to take a shuttle bus to another terminal. Why not say that like other airports e.g. time from here to gate -- then people know where they are and how much time they have - simple. Luckily though I did have enough time due to the airports sheer incompetence. As I write this I am still sitting on the plane after 2.5 hours waiting to be de-iced. I mean who would ever think that it snows in New York in January? If only we could forecast these things and maybe get more than one hairdryer to de-ice 125 planes! I am just passing through from a civilized airport, Heathrow, I am going to avoid this airport in future even if it costs more.

commentHeader: the worst airport we've ever been to
arrivals is a totally disorganised shambles
a very difficult airport to get around
walked from the flight into absolute chaos
we were held for two and a half hours
reviewContent: Interestingly we went through on same date as a previous reviewer. We arrived at terminal 4 on 24th September. Having been through the British Airways terminal a number of years ago you are not prepared for your treatment at terminal 4. We are currently appealing a no show on our taxi company as we were held for two and a half hours through security. My only regret is that I did not ask for the person's ID and name as he was enjoying every minute of the delay he was causing. Can I suggest you get rid of all the people controlling the queues saving that expense in favour of a light and bell system where you are called individually by the desk operator then you don't get the situation we all had which was being directed by a staff member at the head of the main queue to desks where there were already queues and being stuck. Our operator then delighted in closing two desks either side where people were queuing and asking us to merge into one. He then got a query and went off to seek advice delaying it even further. Whilst I think we all appreciate the vigilance we also travelled recently through Paris CDG and London Heathrow both experiencing the same security issues as the US but without the grief experienced in your country. Further to my suggestion of a bell and lighting system perhaps the government could seek advice from every major bank or retailer who operates these systems very efficiently. Interestingly when departing terminal 4 two week later nothing was complicated.

Paris to New York and vice versa through JFK. Horrible experience. The treatment from most of the airport staff was quite degrading. In a previous comment somebody mentioned that, when going through security check, a woman was yelling 'they aint gonna load emselves' to the people so that they put their bags/items onto the conveyor. That is exactly what I heard too. I mean, what are we? Animals? Passport control was even worse. There was a woman there, looking completely unprofessional, that was yelling incoherently to the people to go where she was pointing at. At first, when I was still a bit farther away, I thought it was some crazy person and the security would pick her up, but it was indeed airport staff. Finally, I would imagine that the main airport for one of the biggest cities in the world would be spacious, but far from it; narrow corridors and a general claustrophobic environment.

On arrival at New York JFK we were separated into queues - one for US citizens and one for foreigners. It took over an hour just to reach the ESTA machines. Due to poor signage, we asked what we should do with our little printouts from the machines and were directed along a corridor. Seconds later we were bellowed at by someone asking us to get back in the line. We explained that we'd been sent through but to no avail. We then collected our baggage and then we queued up to leave the airport and give another rude and sullen employee our stamped ticket. Altogether we had waited almost 2 hours. The taxi queue outside was unbelievable. Not due to lack of taxis but to the traffic chaos outside. Everyone for arrivals and departures are at the same place. Cars, buses, taxis with lanes constantly blocked by people stopping wherever they felt like it to unload / load etc. An employee ran up and down, yelling and blowing a whistle to keep the traffic moving. Nowhere is adequately signed e.g. Stand A, B etc. There is just one sign - Passenger Pick up and Drop off. I assume this means along the whole length of the airport. Hence no-one knows where exactly to wait. Everyone asked everyone else what to do. It was absolute chaos. In the queue for the taxi passengers further down were always trying to cut in but after an hour and a half wait, I couldn't blame them. From leaving the plane to getting a taxi took 3.5 hours. Overall the airport is poorly signed, with most monitors showing advertising instead of information. It is a challenge to find the toilets. Seating is limited and the whole atmosphere is stressful and unwelcoming. As for the airport staff - loud and rude is all that I can say. Never again, not even with a connecting flight.

International arrival at JFK Terminal 7, transfer to a domestic flight - Terminal 8. JFK is the worst airport I have ever used, and I've used many. It is almost impossible to make a 3 hour layover as the lines to immigration go forever. You get out of the plane and the line starts already at gate entrance. There is no information what this line was for or what is going on. The only spoken announcements were initially in Spanish. Staff were rude and unhelpful. Took 2 hours to clear immigration, then 30 minutes to check in for the next flight. You need to claim your luggage before transfer. Made it only because my next flight was first delayed, then cancelled - something that happens frequently at JFK. My advice - if you can, use a different airport for your arrival into the US.

commentHeader: a good, convenient to use airport
reviewContent: Considering it is an old airport and among the busiest ones in the world JFK is a good, convenient to use airport. When we landed there it was easy to get through passports (friendly staff) and suitcases arrived quickly. Taxis and transport to the city are easy to find. Departing was also easy with small ques and fast but efficient security control. Not the biggest variety of shops but good enough to spend some time. All in all a good experience.

I flew with a group of my students to New York on a field trip. The last day, the pilots of Lufthansa went on strike. We got to JFK very early to make sure that we were rebooked on a different flight. The airline put us together on the SIA flight to Frankfurt. We had to change terminals going from 1 to 4 with all of our luggage and 5 teenagers who just lost their final day in NYC. After standing in line for more than 1.5 hours, we had to stand in line again for more than 2 hours. By the time we had checked-in, there was no going back to Manhattan. We passed security and hoped for the best. The typical food stands, Starbucks and Shake-a-Shack available. Most of the time they were bored to tears - so my advice, if you travel with boys between 15 and 18 do not get to JFK 4 hours prior departure. JFK has not been built for the A380 and the number of passengers. It is difficult to find available seating at their departure gates and this has happened to me with both LH and SIA.

commentHeader: last time I will use JFK

reviewContent: Terrible. The security area was congested. It took 50 minutes to get through security. Customs and immigration was even more congested and disorganized. It took 50 minutes to get through. This was a contrast to Heathrow which was calm and took only a few minutes and there is free wifi at Heathrow. According to Wikipedia, Heathrow handles a larger number of passengers.

commentHeader: I'll be using Logan next time
could use more outlets on the seats
1 hour to get through inefficient immigration
arrival is quite swift and clear
immigration was very fast and effective
Welcome to America it most certainly was not
line through Customs was long and chaotic
worst airport I have been to
it will definitely make us think twice before returning
minimal shopping and dining once inside

reviewContent: I can’t express enough how grateful I am for the exceptional help I received from Hilary, the gate check agent at Spirit Airlines. I was in a complete panic after losing my cell phone at the airport. With no way to contact my family and let them know when I’d be arriving, I was extremely stressed and worried that they’d be concerned about me. Hillary noticed my distress and went above and beyond by offering to let me use her personal phone to send a quick text to my family. Her kindness, thoughtfulness, and willingness to help me in a moment of crisis made all the difference. Thanks to her, I was able to let my family know when to pick me up, and I could finally breathe a sigh of relief. Never did find my phone but there was a silver lining. Hillary truly saved the day for me, and I can’t thank her enough for her generosity. Spirit Airlines is lucky to have such a compassionate and dedicated employee. Thank you, Hillary, for turning a stressful situation into a manageable one. You have no idea how much your help meant to me!

This airport is disgusting. The bathrooms are filthy with urine and unworking flush mechanisms. Floors throughout terminal 1 appear to rarely get swept or mopped. Im amazed the airport can pass a foodservice inspection. We ate breakfast at the wendys and the seating areas and tables had spilled drinks and food all around the dining space. Trash overflowing. It seems the cleaning crew are non existent or inept. Avoid this airport at all cost. Tsa was friendly and efficient but the rest is a zero.

Review limited to Terminal 1. Arrived at the D gates. The D concourse appears to have more amenities which appear to have more amenities than the B concourse. The concourse is bright and spacious. Departure was from B concourse. The B concourse has only 2 restaurants and lacks amenities. Slot machines take up most of the space at the gates which makes for a very crowded gate area. I didn't notice any in seat USB and/or power outlets. The B concourse needs major renovations to align it the modern and spacious terminals you see at other airports. There is no lounge at either B or C concourse. Free Airport WiFi is fast. We dined at PGA restaurant. One of the worst meals we've had. Our meals were comped (fish & chips) as it was not up to the restaurant's standards.

God bless the amazing lady from Flint Michigan. I can’t remember her name. I threw my back out the day before my flight. I was hunched over and could barely walk. She got a wheel chair for me and took me though security and all the way to my gate. Waited for my plane and rolled me down the jet bridge. I don’t know what I would’ve done without her kindness! I hope she knows how much she’s appreciated!

The TSA employees were very rude! TSA Pre Check was closed! The airport is one of most unclean airport’s I have ever visited. Seating at Gate A has no charging ports on the seats. The experience at LAS makes me extremely grateful to go back to my home airport #BNA.
Sitting area is disgusting! Trash under chairs, carpet very dirty and bathroom were not clean. Water was all over the bathroom ladies room and it was dirty and nasty.

commentHeader: airport seems to hate their customers
reviewContent: This airport seems to hate their customers. Had a layover for a red eye, never a great situation but this airport is especially terrible between 1 am and 6 am. There aren’t many bathrooms in this airport to begin with, and then they shut down every bathroom in the airport at the same time for cleaning around 2am, so good luck. Need to sleep at the gate? Well, the seats have huge metal arm rests to prevent sleeping, so the gate was full of uncomfortable people trying to sleep upright. Then they have loud rock music playing nonstop. And, on top of that the person driving the floor cleaner up and down the walkway constantly honks the horn on it as she passes the terminal full of people trying to sleep. I get that it needs to be cleaned and there is never a great time for that, but blowing the horn nonstop was unnecessary.

Terminal 3, wow. The worst queues I’ve ever seen. Just for TSA Pre Check, the line was backed up a quarter of a mile. The regular line was unheard of, there’s no way anyone is making their flights. Something needs to be done to make the security lines more efficient in Terminal 3.

Agree with other reviews rental car experience a fiasco. Embarrassing for City of Las Vegas. Will avoid in future for sure. Long lines for shuttle which took forever to show. Then, of course, further chaos at actual rental counters.

commentHeader: entire rental car experience is hands down the worst in the country
reviewContent: I travel all over the US. The entire rental car experience at LAS airport is hands down the worst in the country. The shuttle buses take forever to come and they send one of the time every 20 minutes to half an hour with hundreds of people waiting in line, then at the rental car center the lines get even worse. For one of the number one tourist destinations in the country this is absolutely awful and one of the most inefficient clusters at any airport. And today is Sunday, can’t imagine how bad it would be on Friday. This happened the last time I came in November 2022.

Slowest baggage claim I have ever encountered. Arrived 11 PM on Southwest in Terminal C. Very poor signage directing which of many carousels our bags would unload on. When I finally located the correct carousel, the switched it. Poor signage directing travelers to appropriate doors (there are many, many doors) for rental cars. No airport staff on hand to assist. No readily sighted baggage service areas if my bags hadn't showed up (and again, no one I could have asked.) All rent a cars are located in a terminal about 15 minutes away. You have to queue for a common bus to take you there. Long wait for busses both arriving and returning to airport. Bus operations staff generally rude and unhelpful. The departure side of the operations was somewhat better but the rental car return was again, not well run. (The airport part of it, not the rental companies themselves, those were fine) good food options. Overall a less than pleasant experience.

commentHeader: They make it as difficult as possible
reviewContent: I had to pick up my husband after he dropped off a rental car. I've been here before, but apparently the traffic gnomes came and made a huge mess out of everything around here. Forget using your GPS or maps. They make it as difficult as possible. Think I wound up going through Tijuana and back. Not to mention the locals drive like they are going to rearrange your bumper.

commentHeader: extremely reluctant to ever use LAS again
reviewContent: The catering facilities in the departure lounge of Las Vegas airport on the 28th May 2022 was appalling. There was only one food outlet open selling any food and that was Burger King. All of the others were closed. This was at 4pm on a Saturday afternoon. For such a large and busy airport on memorial weekend it is just not good enough. Can someone from the airport management please explain this. I would be extremely reluctant to ever use LAS again.

commentHeader: The TSA agents are extremely rude
reviewContent: The TSA agents are extremely rude, Bathrooms were not kept up, paper towels all over floor, no toilet paper in stalls. Inadequate seating in waiting area, people having to sit on floor! Terrible airport overall.

The queues were to long to get in to the country, minimal staff working hour and a half standing in the queue. No where to sit. Got to the front of the queue and the man left for his break, we asked if we were able to join another queue but he shouted and told us to get behind the yellow line. Extremely rude, poorly organised airport.

commentHeader: there's no reason to treat people that way
reviewContent: Rudest TSA agent I've ever ever encountered. He yelled a profanity at us because we didn't realize our suitcase had to go into a tray. I understand of you're having a bad day and that TSA can be a difficult job but there's no reason to treat people that way.

commentHeader: the least efficient airport in the U.S
reviewContent: Probably the least efficient airport in the U.S. when it comes to rental car rental and return, and the shuttle transportation from the rental car area to the airport. You do not want to be cutting it close to get to your departure gate if dropping off a rental care here, because they certainly aren't in a hurry and the shuttles are few and far between.

commentHeader: There is a taxi problem every time I fly into Las Vegas
reviewContent: Once again a 100+ person taxi line and no cabs. McCarron needs to have at least minimal cab service of some level to meet customer demand. There is a taxi problem every time I fly into Las Vegas.

In the many flights I have been on I have never seen such a disgusting airport. When I say unclean I mean, you don't even want to put your shoes on the floor. No moving sidewalks were working. All tables and counter space were sticky and had trash everywhere. Bathrooms were so bad that I waited to use the one on the airplane. Due to a delayed flight I sat there for 6hrs and saw 1, I repeat 1, cleaning lady come around and smash the trash down instead of taking it out.

I was so disappointed with McCarren Airport on December 6th. Terminal 1 was so over crowded and no one making sure people were wearing mask. It was a chaotic mess. Announcements constantly over the top of each other. Constant gate changes, dirty and broken down woman’s bathroom and overcrowded mess., That terminal created so much stress to everyone. Please, with all the constant traffic through that airport you must do better. I was there on a Monday evening and not a Holliday, could it be worse? It’s a bad experience for customers and I am sure it’s stressful for employees. Way to crowded in all areas and out of control.

commentHeader: Going through TSA was another story
reviewContent: My husband and I are going to see our grandson in MN. We are 71 and 79 years old. We have not flown in 2 years. We are Pre TSA and are flying Sun Country. The check in for Sun Country was great. Going through TSA was another story. The gentleman at the walk through scanner was very rude. I set the beeper off. I said it was probably my anklet. He said that was not possible. I told him that it had happened before. He told me again that was impossible. I removed my Apple Watch and two bracelets. I then was able to go through the scanner. I felt that he was very rude. I understand there can be frustration when dealing with the public. This is the only recourse that I have to express my unhappiness.
American Airlines kiosk not work and unacceptable personal for need and slow service in the baggage drop off, security check point is slow and rude personal for family members including kids.

commentHeader: We almost missed our flight due to this
reviewContent: My laptop with my 3 cell phones were sent to the back for an additional security check. The second scan didn't produce anything wrong. We almost missed our flight due to this additional scan that was caused by what? It was unnecessary! Maybe the security scan machines are defective and/or need additional cleaning/rebooting?

commentHeader: the TSA checkpoint was confusing and frustrating
reviewContent: Going through the TSA checkpoint was confusing and frustrating. The TSA agents kept giving me conflicting instructions. Take off your shoes, you can put your shoes back on if you walked through the K9 area, put your shoes on to walk through the metal detector. It made absolutely no sense and when I acknowledged it I just received blank stares from them. The conveyor belt stopped working because someone’s bag jammed it because the TSA agents failed to tell the person to put their bag in a tray. I watched them watch the person put the bag loose on the conveyor belt and then fail to give them correct instructions. Then as they were trying to fix the jammed conveyor belt a TSA agent came over to where I was and said that it had stopped working because a tray was still in the tray dispenser. I don’t believe this had anything to do with what the problem was, and there were trays sitting in other tray dispensers, but they decided it was the one in front of me that was the problem and gave me stern look. Again, that makes no sense, my tray didn’t jam it. They need to improve their system and communicate better with each other and with people who are traveling because we are not mind readers. I see this happen a lot with incompetent employees, they can easily blame the customer for a problem. In this case it really seemed like the TSA agents were causing problems for themselves. What would a person gain by not following instructions and delaying their travel time at the airport? I felt frustrated enough to write this review, and felt completely validated to see other negative reviews.

commentHeader: the worst airport I’ve ever been through
reviewContent: This is the worst airport I’ve ever been through. I travel here several times a month for work and have never not had my flight delayed or cancelled.

Long term parking is ridiculous. You park on International or Domestic side which both lead you to terminal 3 D Gates. We almost missed our flight for departure because the security gate was not open and had no other way to get to gate C. We had all 3 teams to get there. When arriving try to find the Tram but you can only take a shuttle. I asked several people where to get to long term parking and not one person could answer other than leading me to Public parking. Never mentioned a tram. So we wonder around again looking for a way to get to Terminal 3 because we arrived in terminal 1. There are no signs anywhere but on the last elevator by the front door. All the TSA agents were absolutely rude when asked any questions. Not only by us but by anyone around I saw asking them how to get to a location. Get better signage, better way to longer term parking and friendlier staff.

commentHeader: Any future trips to Vegas, I'll fly else where and drive in
reviewContent: Arrival uneventful with exception of extremely long walk to bag claim. Departure gate c/d TSA security rude when an item was out of spec with rules. Just say "sir you can take the bottle and dump it and re-screen, or leave the bottle", all of his attitude wasn't called for. I don't stereotype but this falls right in line with what I would have guessed. I re-screened and passed. Looked at the TSA agent and told him to have a really great day. TSA body scans kids. I know, because they tried to scan mine. Just because shes tall doesn't make her older. Seating areas look like the 1980's. Charging ports in that area are few and far between. The prison gray, white and black color exude such warmth and welcome. Any future trips to Vegas, I'll fly else where and drive in.

commentHeader: She rudely told me to move on
reviewContent: Arriving at the Terminal 1 passenger pickup this morning from the cell phone lot, I exited my vehicle and walked to my trunk to open it up. I was immediately approached by the ‘traffic person’ before I even got it open. She rudely told me to move on. I said my friend was approaching but she again told me I needed to move. My friend was approaching my car but this rude woman told me to point her out because she didn’t believe me. There were only three or four people who had finished crossing the walkway. There was no line of cars waiting for anything, in fact there were very few cars there at all, but this woman was determined to make me leave. That’s when my friend stopped with her luggage to put into the trunk. I had been stopped less than two minutes. The woman didn’t leave us even then but continued to be as unpleasant as she could. My friend and I are both in our mid seventies and I hate to think how someone with a disability would be treated. If this is the way you represent Las Vegas to the world we deserve the very worst criticism of all. The attitude of these people should at least attempt to be hospitable if not helpful.

commentHeader: This an obtuse way to treat people
reviewContent: Get more rental car trams / buses. This an obtuse way to treat people. I have never waited this long to get on a rental car bus either arrival or departure. Absolutely ridiculous! Makes me not want to ever come back here, get it together.

commentHeader: we were treated like VIP’s by American Airlines
reviewContent: When we started our trip in Savannah, GA we had ask for assistance. When we arrived in Las Vegas there was someone waiting at the door with a wheelchair. This employee was excellent! He took us from one terminal to where we were to pickup our luggage. Waited with us for the luggage then took us out side and hailed a cab for us. He also gave us his card so when we return to leave we can call on the way to the airport and they will be waiting for us to get us to the plane. Even though we were basic economy we were treated like VIP’s by American Airlines.

commentHeader: LAS is just a really dirty airport overall
reviewContent: For such a newly improved airport, McCarran sure is trash! This is the worst practically new airport I've seen anywhere in the world. I don't know what the casino revenues collected in Vegas, or even the airport itself, are going toward, but it sure isn't toward having a meaningfully modern, efficient airport, despite the many years and dollars spent on revitalization. For the pros - 1) Baggage claim was actually efficient. 2) Signage inside the airport was ample. That's about it. As for the cons? 1) There is no efficient means to take a rideshare or taxi, as the wait for either can be over an hour. It took me 40 minutes and I felt lucky compared to the people around me. 2) There's no effective means of public transportation to the Strip and this is considering that the airport is practically on the Strip! Not even a monorail. 3) The terminals have mostly new, though very depressing and uninviting, architecture and design. 4) The terminals were poorly lit, in both the late evening and early morning. 5) I saw a tiny handful of anyone working in the airport who smiled, or who otherwise just didn't look angry. 6) Airline (baggage claim) and security personnel were almost entirely ill-mannered and officious. Not just "having a stressful morning and need coffee," but flat-out rude. 7) Apparently this airport doesn't believe in automated check-in and baggage machines, even though they're chock full of them, Alaska, Frontier, Southwest, etc. weren't operating theirs, and required their passengers to stand in long lines (of course, if you checked in in advance and have no baggage to claim, this isn't a problem for you). 8) LAS is just a really dirty airport overall, plain and simple. 9) Practically nothing was open in the airport at either 9pm or 6am, I guess this isn't a huge deal to me only because we're still in the midst of a pandemic. I understand that LAS has to interact with a never-ending array of passengers who don't even understand clear airport signage or etiquette, but I would respectfully suggest that LAS look to Salt Lake City (stunning new airport with overall great service) or even Phoenix (which is above-average but not great) as examples of how to operate a respectable airport.

commentHeader: rudely, disrespectfully, and unprofessionally approached me
reviewContent: Ride share pickup area. At 08.00 on February 27, I was dispatched to the rideshare pickup lot to pickup a passenger. Upon arrival, because my vehicle is equipped with a wheel chair rack, which extends three to the rear of vehicle, if I pull my vehicle diagonally into a parking stall I would create a traffic hazard behind me. To be safe without blocking traffic, I pull in parallel to the stall post. Your parking patrol person, rudely, disrespectfully, and unprofessionally approached me and started yelling at me.

Food price is too expensive. One small bottle of orange juice $4.25. Compare with walmart just $1. All fountain water are shut off due to covid19. People has no choice has to buy food and drink with the price that no choice. Government should control and inspect food price at all airports. Why they can control people who rip off merchandise like hand sanitize, glove etc. out there but not at airport's merchandise.

My wife only had a paper copy of her Drivers License. We just got married and booked her flight under her new name. We had no issues flying from Denver they were helpful and professional, but Las Vegas TSA was a mess. They told her to change her surname back to her maiden in order to get through security. She had to go back to Spirit and ask them to change her name on her ticket to match her passport. She had already flown with her new name in their system, but the Spirit staff member was amazing helping her cancel her flight and then re-book it to comply with TSA. Long story short they asked her to travel with a name that is no longer her legal name. She had all the documents needed marriage certificate, new social, new debit cards, new temporary license, and her passport with her maiden name, and her old voided I.D. but it still wasn't enough. Get it together! How does one airport know how to handle this matter efficiently and you guys can't.

commentHeader: have never seen so much mistreatment on handling people
reviewContent: My older brother has Autism and the TSA agents kept yelling at him. The first was yelling at him to move up as my brother was walking but I guess it wasn’t fast enough. When my mom said he’s Autistic, he says “well you need to get him and tell him”, she said I was but you keep yelling at us. The canine was out and we had to pair up. My dad was trying to be my brothers partner because he’s afraid of dogs. But the lady TSA agent wasn’t listening because she was yelling at him to go. So because he was hesitant because of the dog the agent with the dog kept yelling at him as well. We (my parents and I) yelled back he’s autistic stop yelling at him. I travel a lot and have never seen so much mistreatment on handling people.

commentHeader: if you hate your job then quit
reviewContent: I know being a TSA agent is probably very difficult but I do follow all the rules and try to be pleasant to you all but when I am treated like a five year old and told to line up against the wall “just like you learned in the first grade” than I get annoyed. Don’t wave me off and say stay here and don’t move! How about being nicer if you hate your job then quit. I would be fired on the spot for being rude to a patient of mine! Find a job that does not let you near people .. have a better day for the agents at gate D

commentHeader: no social distancing at all in this airport
reviewContent: There is no social distancing at all in this airport! I asked an agent for help for the distancing she said it was not her job! This is a dangerous place for your health, masks are not enough, social distancing and washing your hands is the base for the protection of all! It is not that complicated, I saw it applied everywhere else in Vegas. I live here so I know first hand.

This airport is literally dangerous to your health. At least 50 percent of the people are not wearing masks, and indignant about it. Making matters worse the airport is just as packed as it ever was. Stay away.

commentHeader: went above and beyond for me
reviewContent: The ground transportation staff at McCarran airport went above and beyond for me. I had dropped my phone in my Uber upon arriving and though I found out quite quickly, the Uber was already gone. Ground transportation personnel called my phone repeatedly until the drivers next customer noticed and they returned my phone before I had to fly. Always get to the airport early, just in case something unexpected happens. Thank you to the wonderful people working in Ground Transportation.

commentHeader: How can an airport be so poorly planned
reviewContent: Arrived from Mexico and had to walk through 100s of yards, possibly over a mile to get to customs and again after customs only to arrive at the far end of terminal 3. All transportation options were at the other end of the terminal. How can an airport be so poorly planned. At departure a few days later in terminal 1, TSA PreCheck was closed at 6.30 pm on a Sunday? Long line ups at security. Again very long walk to A gates and four moving sidewalks that were not functioning, not one but all four. Give me a break, most third world airports are superior to McCarran.

I would like to commend the Staff at the Departure Gate for WestJet at the Las Vegas Airport. I was flying to Vancouver on February 1/20, flight 1789 and had misplaced my passport. When I called the airline directly I was informed that a Passport was required to board the aircraft. I had cleared Security and was already checked in for boarding. The agent at the WestJet Departure Lounge was so helpful and patient. He took my information and identification and called the airline. I did have a copy of my passport with me, which was verified. After 15 minutes I was told I could board the plane to Vancouver and then on to the connecting flight to Kelowna, B.C. I cannot tell you what relief and good news that was. I cannot say enough about the service and handling of this situation by the agent that assisted me.

Las Vegas - worst TSA experience I have ever had. Rude and unprofessional. I’m all for security, but rummaging through a 13 year olds bag while looking at her and not the contents of her bag which is falling on the floor is awful. They didn’t check anything, not even her eyeglass case. Just tossed everything around and let it fall on the floor. Then took my 17 year olds bag away without explanation to the walkthrough screening out of view, wouldn’t answer where they’d were taking bag, squatted and searched out of our view and sent bag back. My visibly upset, crying, angry daughter was made fun of by TSA so I said that it was wrong to make fun of a kid. He said he was “communicating” with his coworker to see if he was in trouble. Communicating in customer service is asking if coworker needs help. He was just being a mean person. Then the man asked if she wanted to speak to a supervisor, and my daughter said yes. TSA agent simply walked away telling everyone he didn’t know why she was so upset. When my daughter opened her bag, nothing but her underwear was touched (it was on a pocket on side of the bag). It’s despicable and nasty. Grown men bullying teenage girls and their mom. They only stopped when my husband walked into view from around the corner. Disgusting. She filed a complaint and we will too.

Got my multitool confiscated at LAS checkpoint. I had flown out of LAS with the same tool not even 5 days before with no problems. TSA was very nice about it, but I still had to throw away a gift from a friend no longer with me. The reason I couldn't have this tool? it had a 2in "saw" blade. My question is what am I supposed to do with a 2in sawblade thats going to cause such havoc that I cant bring it with me? Again, TSA was nice, but the rule doesn't make sense.

commentHeader: Pre TSA is strongly advised here
reviewContent: Arrival was fine, but going through TSA at this airport was the absolute worst ever. I thought that since it was a smaller airport, it was be easier. Man, was I wrong! We left from the huge Atlanta airport and went through TSA with no problems. At McCarran, the people were rude, we had to stand in front of a machine to be scanned with our legs spread and arms up over our heads. Then we were frisked! Everyone had to do both of those things, not in Atlanta! I also made the mistake of buying a gift of lotion for a friend and it was confiscated! I know that I don't look like a terrorist, but I do know their rules. The woman had absolutely no empathy at all. The lotion was still factory wrapped. What the heck do they do with the things that they confiscate? That lotion was $20. I've never been treated so badly at any airport ever! Pre TSA is strongly advised here.

commentHeader: the most abusive I have ever experienced
reviewContent: I have to report that the TSA agents in Las Vegas Airport are the most abusive I have ever experienced. To say they are arrogant, angry, condescending, and very loud would be an understatement. I have never been treated with so little respect while going through security in my life. Commands were shouted and if not complied with immediately further abuse was received. I purposely wear a plastic belt to enable easy pass through security but an officer barked at me to remove it. I accidentally left a hotel key in my pocket and this gave me the pleasure of a full body pat down including my crotch and hand swab. My carry on had to re x-rayed because I failed to separate all items as requested and I was suitably chastised for my inability to complete their orders. In addition they insist on shoe removal, even when I was wearing plastic flip flops. In conclusion I hope this situation with the TSA improves as this experience has left a bad taste in mouth after fun few days in Las Vegas.

Visited Las Vegas for the first time recently. Our trip was wonderful, but our experience traveling through this airport ruined it. From the Fox Rental Car shuttle the bad treatment started, and it just got worse. Nearly every 'service' person we dealt with, from the American Airlines check-in, to the shop assistants, TSA, Burger King lady, and nearly every AA representative we were forced to deal with was breathtakingly rude, and sometimes downright bullying. And my husband and I are very polite and patient people. We spent the night in the freezing airport due to AA incompetence and got nothing but hostility from nearly everyone we (politely) approached for help or information. When we were finally put on a plane with the help of one American Airlines employee, I witnessed at least four other passengers being treated terribly for no reason. It's like they are trained to abuse their clients. The icing on the cake was the 2 AA cabin crew members getting into a very loud fight in the back of the plane. The tension on the plane was palpable. I've never experienced this in my life, and suddenly the news reports about passengers flipping out on planes seemed understandable. I'm not surprised, if it happens on American Airlines, and guess what? It would be totally the fault of those employees. Terrible, shameful treatment of their clients. I will never fly AA again, and will never pass through McCarron airport again. Beware!

The airport security/police are extremely rude and inconsiderate of any factors that might be slowing you down (in our case a 1 year old who was unwell). While waiting in the line, we were up next and we see this one officer who's just staring at us. While I am used to them signalling us to proceed and seeing nothing from him, I asked if we could. To this he shouts from there "why are you making things difficult?". I asked him softly, "how did we make things difficult for you?. We were waiting for you to let us know if we could proceed". He angrily responds "your ID and passes". We didn't want to take this any further. It seemed to be the normal at Mccarran.

commentHeader: Come on Mccarran! You can do better than this
reviewContent: Arrived at 8:20pm on 29 May 2019 from Zurich. Took 43 min to clear immigration. Total of 28 immigration channels, only 6 were staffed. 6 passport scanning machines (2 were out of order) but the airport staff said “they are not working right now” even though 4 showed green serviceable light. I asked another staff why we can’t use the passport scanners and got another answer “There aren’t enough immigration officers”. Well, isn’t that the point? Passengers using the passport scanning machines and having their fingerprints and photos taken, cuts down on the amount of time the immigration officer processes each passenger? Come on Mccarran! You can do better than this!
Filthy, smelly, it might be the worst, dirtiest cramped airport I’ve ever been in. Once you have been here all other airports will be a step up. It’s awful.

Had a long layover at this airport and was very disappointed. It is very poorly organized and has very few and poor food choices. The foods that it does have is grossly overpriced, even by airport standards.

commentHeader: Get rid of the blaring music
reviewContent: Pet relief area is a very welcome addition. Music playing in background is like being in a club. Way too loud and not necessary. Very upsetting to small children and support animals because of how loud it is. Why do we need all that background noise. If people want music they usually have it on their phones. It is nerve wracking and adds to anxiety. We have to be at the airport for so long, that doesn’t take in delays. Get rid of the blaring music.

commentHeader: very disappointing for this level of airport
reviewContent: The airport is a very clean and nice airport but what surprised me and my wife is that this airport does not have hotspot that you can order a Taxi or Uber taxi. Yes it does not have a WiFi connection but only in the main terminal. No phone to order taxi as well. So if you of a need to order a taxi at 3 am as we did, you have to drag your several suitcases with you to the outside parking over a small bridge back to the parking just to find out that there is no internet there so you will not be able to see if your taxi is coming. So the solution is to run between the main terminal to the parking and from the main terminal to the Uber parking, this is a very disappointing for this level of airport, what a shame. The shuttle to rent a car organizes was very rude and did not organize the lineup at all, he was just standing there beside the bus doing nothing and when I said to him that he should do his job he was rude.

The TSA staff were the rudest that I have ever seen. They were barking orders and telling you where to go but, then they were not ready. Then they were yelling again what to do or not do. It's sad, they must really hate their jobs. Maybe they need a change of leadership or morale team building.

commentHeader: the worst I have ever experienced
reviewContent: I have to report that the TSA agents in Las Vegas Airport are the worst I have ever experienced. To say they are arrogant, angry, condescending, and very loud would be an understatement. I have never been treated with so little respect while going through security in my life. Commands were shouted and if not complied with immediately further abuse was received. I purposely wear a plastic belt to enable easy pass through security but an officer barked at me to remove it. I accidently left a dime in pocket and this gave me the pleasure of a full body pat down and hand swab. My carry on had to re x-rayed because I failed to separate all items as requested and I was suitably chastised for my inability to complete their orders. In addition they insist on shoe removal, even when there is no metal in them, but there are only a couple of metal seats to assist in re-shoeing. In conclusion I hope this situation with the TSA improves as this experience has left a bad taste in mouth after a fantastic few days in Las Vegas.

commentHeader: do not fly into or from Las Vegas
reviewContent: If you are pregnant and wanting to do a pat down opt out going through security do not fly into or from Las Vegas Airport. You will be harassed.
