Arrived at airport two hours before my flight and made it with minutes to spare. It's like a horrible maze designed to make you miss your flight. I have no idea how much I'll have to pay for parking, and I parked outside with the winter storm today, I have no idea if my car will even be there when I get back.

This airport is poorly staffed, slow, disorganized, confusing, dirty, old, and expensive. In the words of a previous review, “a total disaster”. Worst airport I’ve ever been in and  I’ve been to Kathmandu, Nepal, which more resembled a shed than an airport.

commentHeader: food at this airport is a total scam
reviewContent: My review is for the food at this airport. Why would an airport ever have one vendor for the entire airport. That is absolutely outrageous. There is absolutely zero competition and horrible selections for full blown gouging prices. Can you believe a food court with different places, all owned by the same company, ridiculous. $6 for a slice of pizza. $7 for a bag of candy and a drink. $12 for a small sandwich. Absolutely outrageous. This company should be completely fired and removed from this airport immediately. The food at this airport is a total scam.

commentHeader: airport feels very old and outdated
reviewContent: How is it possible that the Greatest City on Earth has this joke of an airport for domestic flights? The airport feels very old and outdated. Food court available only before the security. Once you pass security - there’s not much choice at all! Restrooms are not cleaned regularly. It’s time to modernize LGA - New Yorkers deserve better!

commentHeader: the worst I have ever been to
reviewContent: This airport is the worst I have ever been to. I have flown all over the world and have never experienced anything this bad. On top of the poor conditions the staff are rude and in no way helpful. I swore many years ago I would never use La Guardia again and after trying one more time I am comfortable never using this terrible airport again.

I have travelled many airports throughout the world. Terminal 1 in La Guardia is by far the worse! Free WiFi for 30 minutes, are you in the Stone Age? If your flight gets delayed, you do not have much to do. No good facilities to talk about. I do not think we will use this airport again.

commentHeader: a disgrace to this thing we call airports"
reviewContent: La Guardia is a disgrace to this thing we call airports. Advertised $4 hot dog? Useless iPads will clear that up for you! $12 for a hot dog. Over $20 for a full meal. No restaurants for people who want something quick and cheap, and even the stores that sell fast snacks had terrible selection (they don't even sell Doritos). Literally every flight was delayed: we were misinformed multiple times about the extent of our delay, about whether or not we were waiting on another aircraft to arrive or if they were going to use a different aircraft. The WiFi is ridiculously expensive, hence the urge to write a terrible review during your free complimentary 30 minutes of wifi before you are kicked off and forced to pay! But, if wasting your own hard earned money and valuable time doesn't bother you, then you'll absolutely love this airport!

What moron thought up the airport bus system to rental cars. Two transfers, miss marked buses, inaccurate directions. Biden was mistaken, LaGuardia is not a third world country, it’s a failed country. This is a terrible airport. NYC should shut it down, tear it down, and start all over.

La Guardia airport is a total zoo. When I flew back in 2014 it was a disaster, 3 years later nothing has changed. When AA took over US Airways they got Terminal C which is where the legacy US Airways routes including flights to Charlotte depart. Terminal C is awful, very small, limited food options and very little seating, the AA side of the terminal is bland while the Delta side is a lot nicer with iPads (with almost no apps) set up. Airport is very very old and very dirty and everything seems to be falling apart. Expect your flight to be delayed out of LGA flight rarely leave LaGuardia on time. Our flight ended up leaving 45 minutes late, check-in was super slow and so was security, most of the staff are completely clueless and have no idea what is going on. When arriving in LaGuardia they gave us the wrong carousel for our bags and after waiting 30 minute we finally found them at a different carousel on the other side of arrivals and the airport staff had absolutely no idea! While JFK and Newark can also have quite a bit of problems LaGuardia seems to be one of the worst, so avoid!

I have been flying 3+ times a year for the last 10 years. I'm extremely disappointed with my experience at La Guardia both the arrival and departure. When I arrived I felt as though I was boarding he subway, the smell was horrendous. When I was going through security for the departure I have never met ruder people.

When I departed the airport on a Saturday morning, security lines were really short but I was hungry for breakfast so I went to a restaurant. The food was extremely over priced. $4 for toast and $5 for water. Very upsetting but the good thing was that my flight departed on time. When I got back on Monday, I had a much better experience. The moment I got to the taxi line, the dispatcher got me a taxi and I was on my way.

commentHeader: This airport is a total disaster
reviewContent: This airport is a total disaster. They are under construction so go figure. There is a lot of traffic due to the exterior color metrication. The TSA pre-check was fast. Once in the terminal there are a few restaurants and a couple of stores. Food and beverage prices are a little high, your typical airport prices. The airport crew can be a little nasty and not helpful. They didn't allow me to start inside the terminal as my flights kept on being canceled and got stranded there for 3 days. The construction means that some areas are closed, and everything feels right.

This airport is a total disaster. They are under construction so go figure. There is a lot of traffic due to the exterior color metrication. The TSA pre-check was fast. Once in the terminal there are a few restaurants and a couple of stores. Food and beverage prices are a little high, your typical airport prices. The airport crew can be a little nasty and not helpful. They didn't allow me to start inside the terminal as my flights kept on being canceled and got stranded there for 3 days. The construction means that some areas are closed, and everything feels right.

La Guardia airport is a total disaster. They are under construction so go figure. There is a lot of traffic due to the exterior works. The TSA pre-check was fast. Once in the terminal there are a few restaurants and a couple of stores. Food and beverage prices are a little high, your typical airport prices. The airport crew can be a little nasty and not helpful. They didn't allow me to stay inside the terminal as my flights kept on being canceled and got stranded there for 3 days. The construction means that some areas are closed.

commentHeader: woman is still there doing nothing
reviewContent: Friday July 21. I arrive at the airport to meet my daughter and her 3-year-old son. Their Spirit flight from Chicago is arriving at least one hour late. I am told the only place to wait for arriving passengers is near baggage claim. There is a woman there, apparently doing nothing, in a kind of uniform wearing a badge reading something like "passenger assistant". I ask her where to find an arrivals monitor. She laughs and says: "there are no such monitors here". I ask where to find them elsewhere, she says "there are only departures monitors". I express my surprise, she keeps laughing and she says "this is how this airport is right now". Then I ask her to please find information about Spirit 630, she laughs again and says "it's impossible". Then I wander about the airport, finally spotting, on the floor above, an arrivals monitor. The arrival appears to be imminent, so I go downstairs not to miss my daughter. Of course I still don't know whether the plane has landed. The woman is still there doing nothing.

commentHeader: through security in less than 10 minutes
reviewContent: 7.30am departure on Air Canada in La Guardia Terminal B on a Monday morning could have been an anxious experience but it was shockingly smooth. We were through security in less than 10 minutes. The A gate area is small, but there was seating for all and food options available with short queues at 6.30am. There was even a tiny duty free shop open. 30min of free wifi is available and worked fine.

Our 5-hour layover at La Guardia Airport was very unpleasant. We were in the B Terminal for the entire layover. The women's restroom had only 1 stall, the wait was long, & the only sink was clogged & already half-filled with "used" water. We were subjected to a dirty terminal, as well as having to breathe plane fumes in what was already a stuffy & poorly ventilated waiting area/corridor. Until such time as we receive confirmed evidence that this airport has been upgraded & cleaned up, we will not be choosing flights that either arrive or depart from this extremely poorly maintained facility.

I arrived at La Guardia airport in American / Delta terminal and had to wait 50 minutes to meet my colleague flying in on a separate flight. There is nowhere to sit - period. When I enquired I was told by an airport employee that all seating was taken out due to the homeless population. As a traveler who has paid for a flight into NY that should not become my burden. I am saddened by the homeless population but I am a senior citizen north of 60 and to not have a place to sit seems unhealthy and unreasonable.

commentHeader: parking buses are inconsistent and sporadic
reviewContent: I understand that the parking is difficult and you have to leave at least another hour plus. The buses are so inconsistent and sporadic at La Guardia that the system is in disarray. Upon our arrival for our first flight the bus we needed was no where to be found. Another bus radioed the correct bus and no answer. He was nice enough to bring us close to our terminal since we waited over 40 minutes. If this driver didn't help us we probably would have missed our flight. Upon our return the same senerio happened- no directions and every employee we asked hadn't a clue. We waited 40 minutes and the driver stops and talked to everyone he knows bringing the trip to retrieve our car close to a hour and 10 min. The airport should institute and educate directions to their employees and have signs for where to go. Airport staff as far as TSA, American Airlines staff and the Hudson news staff were excellent. This isn't our first time parking since construction. Once the parking issue is complete it will be seamless like prior to the construction.

commentHeader: getting to La Guardia was a nightmare
a disgrace to all of NY
does need a lot of upgrading
only has one security line open
the most pathetic car wash I've ever received
reviewContent: Long Beach Airport is one of the nicest airports to fly in and out of without hassle or delays. However, if you intend to park your car with the Long Beach valet service, don't expect the complimentary car wash to be a car wash. It was the most pathetic car wash I've ever received. A toddler could have hosed it off better. The cost to park was $24 a day. I was gone on a business trip for 24 hours and when I returned I expected a nice clean car. I was wrong. Don't park your car with the valet expecting a decent Car Wash. Thank you.

I fly out of Long Beach airport whenever I can, business and personal travel. My friends and family choose to do the same. I've only had good experiences until today, 8/14 while picking up a friend and her family. The bad experience was related to a Long Beach police officer monitoring vehicles curbside. I was approached by the officer as I was opening up the back of my SUV for loading luggage. He asked me to move my vehicle twice, even after I told him my friend and her family were walking over from the luggage area outside of the airport. His demeanor and tone were aggressive and he didn't care to listen when I said my friend and her family were approaching the vehicle. He raised his voice and came very close, it made me uncomfortable. Fortunately, my friend and her family walked up, greeted me and asked what was going on. The officer just walked away. The officers conduct was unprofessional and not appropriate.

commentHeader: small and so very easy to deal with
better than what it was before
reviewContent: The airport has been updated and it’s much better than what it was before, but still doesn’t even have a business lounge or place to go to if your flight is delayed and every time I fly through MCI, the ladies’ bathroom in the Terminal always has a very long line, because the other option is the ALL Gender bathroom, but a lot of women don’t feel comfortable sharing a bathroom with men.

commentHeader: like the size and style of the facility
reviewContent: Southwest 4 hour layover on a return trip from Cancun. Airport is quite nice and modern. With enough space to accommodate surges. I'll take this airport any day over an Atlanta Delta layover. Clearly a new addition to the Kansas field (did not experience old terminal). Customs/bag claim, re-check, and re-screen for TSA for the domestic leg was super quick. Really like the glass jetways. Friendly TSA and gate agents. Bag claim and TSA were all quite clean. Gate areas were dirty - and not in the post-rush kind of way. Heavy duty cleaning seemed neglected/deferred. One example that stuck out: Dusty and fingerprints on window area/sills, etc. Bathroom sink areas could have received more attention. Some soap dispensers not functioning. A small gripe: Impossible to get a bottled unsweet tea anywhere in the facility. Every retail business had the exact same drinks in their grab and go coolers. My guess is it is contracted out to Pepsico or something. What's the point of having multiple retail businesses if they all serve the same stuff? Overall, I really like the size and style of the facility. Will look forward to my next layover here, should the time come.

Getting from drop off to your gate takes forever. After you check in with airline they have you walk a country mile to get to security. Than its another country mike to get to your gate which was Delta but God help you if you took Southwest. The old airport was fast and easy. What were they thinking. Poorly designed.
The bathrooms look like they haven’t been cleaned in weeks. Splatters on the back of the toilets, dirty floors, dusty everything. Looks like all they do is refill toilet paper and seat covers
I have waited for about 1.5 hours to enter the gate. It was so disappointed and I haven’t experienced it before in any airport. The worst airport ever.

commentHeader: Little to no signage for anything
reviewContent: The old airport was great. Fast TSA, comfortable gate seating, no frills. The new one - not even close. Check in was very clunky, there's no real traffic flow, just a mass of passengers. Horrible, slow TSA (similar to Atlanta). Way too many shops and restaurants. Little to no signage for anything. The gate seating area only sat 55 passengers. More shops and restaurants, why are there any at all? An airport is not a destination, it's a thoroughfare. I attempted to find a bathroom and looked until I saw a sign flat on the door (no hanging sign). Overall a poor experience with something that was supposed to make life better. Next time I'll fly out of St Louis.

The new airport is very pretty but there are some important things missing. The signage is not great. They must have forgotten about signs for baggage claim because they only have sandwich boards in the main terminal area directing you to the baggage claim. We found NO SIGNS for rental car area. Finally got a broadcast on the PA regarding car rental location and shuttle. The TSA lines were very long even though not many people are here. They had the area roped of as if they were expecting a large crowd and didn't bother to shorten the lanes when not needed causing people to walk more than necessary. The new seats are uncomfortable. Our TSA person at the baggage check area was rude and didn't seem to know the rules for people over 75. I realize it is a work in progress but seems like some of these issues should have been obvious to the designers and planners. Lets hope it gets better as time goes by.

Feedback on my initial visit to MCI (new terminal). I am a Kansas City native --- this review is critical, as it should be. Overall impression is outstanding compared to the 1970s era terminals. It addresses the needs of a 21st century Midwest airport with all the modern necessities one would expect as a flying customer. First impression walking in, it's big. It spans wide and the design incorporating natural lighting with an abundance of windows is refreshing. The evening sunlight streaming in through different angles really provides a "non-restricted" feel as you walk about the terminal. The respective airline check-in counter/placements are easy to identify and span the width of the front end of the terminal for easy access. Security access is fairly streamlined and the entire process is able to accommodate large volumes of travelers (non-TSA airport - VMD corp) more natural light as you progress through each arm of the terminal (A/B/C) with interior lighting not overbearing. The walkways are wide and allow for excellent views of the tarmac, exterior gates, and various angles of the entirety of the taxiways and runways. Additionally, the escalators and walking escalators are positioned nicely and push you through terminal in a speedy manner. More shops, etc. at each terminal branch, providing basically anything the traveler would need. The vibe and local venues are all a welcome addition and definitely fulfill the needs of the traveler. Individual gates and structured well and offer comfortable seating and ample wireless device charging. The one thing that seems odd is the placement of the gate flight monitor(s). It is essentially in the seating area of the individual gates. Why not place it directly behind/above the agent booth/desk for easy and quick access and explanation (poor design decision). Boarding the plane, the traveler is treated to long glass jet bridges that allow for excellent views of adjacent aircraft and outside weather conditions. This is a well thought out design that many major airports do not offer. Overall, the new MCI/KCI terminal is a massive upgrade to the Kansas City area. It has the opportunity for expansion and I would expect future modifications to address design shortfalls and customer feedback. We concluded it feels like a mall when walking though the new terminal. Three things need immediate addressing - (1) Men's restroom upkeep and sanitary conditions unacceptable. Need to revisit the options of installing automatic hand blower machines and look at the cleaning schedules to ensure conditions do not deteriorate to the point of being an embarrassment.  Cleaning crews need to maintain a regular schedule on vacuuming the terminal carpet - paper and debris everywhere.  Please explain how the gate flight monitors are controlled by the city? How is this beneficial to the traveler or airline staff? Local control to change/modify the monitors shouldn't even be a discussion. This new terminal is supposed to represent the pride of Kansas City aviation.

Brand new airport that looks pretty nice but housekeeping services are poor in and outside the airport. They tried to make it local Kansas City restaurants only so don’t look for a Starbucks, you won’t find one. Seating at gates is sufficient with work table space as well.

Poor lighting for road signs for rental car return. By the grace of God I was not killed, I was going head on to incoming traffic the wrong way because of poor lighting, it was 4 am on May 11 2023. Lack of signs and direction for rental car return. Please fix this problem before someone is hurt.

Brand new, pretty and nice but very inconvenient. They did not provide enough space to check is thus creating chaos. Confusing lines, no one was helping. For departing passengers using parking shuttle you get down on arrival area then get to upper level to ticketing, only 1 escalator going up and down. If not working you have to carry your check in luggage. very high escalator, did not see option for stairs and minimal number of elevators. Once you check-in getting to your terminal is a long walk not enough moving walkway. Beautiful but not functional, poorly planned new airport. Spent money to make it beautiful but poorly functional. Very inconvenient airport. If I don’t live in Kansas City, will surely avoid this airport.

commentHeader: by far the worst I've been in
reviewContent: I fly 20-30 trips per year and KC Airport is by far the worst I've been in. We almost missed our transfer flight because doorways exiting terminals were not adequately marked so we had to go through TSA again. Another lady said she had the same experience. TSA people took my reusable water bottle because it was full of water from last airport and would only let me leave airport and pour out. Before all this happened, I went to the restroom, which was shockingly filthy, broken doors, non working towel dispensers, half smashed toilet paper dispensers.

Terrible customer space and internet as compared to other cities. No room to sit or eat when your flight is delayed or cancelled. Taking the shuttle back and forth to the rental car is awful. Let’s no get started with the internet and cell phone coverage in this concrete jungle. Tell your customers to move.

commentHeader: this is not an airport where I want to return
reviewContent: Arriving in Kansas City wasn't too bad, but departing was awful. The airport is broken into a lot of little areas for gates, and of course you can only go behind security in the one serving your airline. It seemed like all of the pre-security restaurants were closed, and in the Delta area there was only one post-security sit down restaurant, which charged an obscene amount of money even by airport standards. The airport itself is poorly lit, with a lot of broken stairs and escalators, and just gave off a depressing vibe. The only good thing is that security was very fast. But overall, this is not an airport where I want to return.

I use to live in KC several years. Just flew in tonight and completely appalled by MCI. Yes it has always been small, very outdated and practically no where to eat and shop but tonight when I got off plane about 10.15, it stunk beyond words. Trash was piled high, it smelt like bathroom was clogged up and people were trying to find seating wherever they could. The smell literally made me physically sick to my stomach once I got outside. For someone seeing this as first impression of a beautiful city it missed the mark big time. Come on KC it’s time to take some pride in your airport.

commentHeader: This has got to be one of the worst airports
reviewContent: This has got to be one of the worst airports I have ever been to and believe me I have traveled extensively. From the rude, loud, and verbally abusive TSA agents, the antiquated equipment, slow processing of bags and personnel, and just down right lack of up to date knowledge, this is your first interaction with the Terminal and sets a horrible tone. Then lets move onto the facilities or complete lack thereof. Restrooms are dirty and never maintained or stocked and you have to be skinny, traveling with no bags, and have a lack of smell to even get into and use one if you can find it. Choices for food or drink are limited, outlandishly overpriced (more than other airports), and if you do get anything its stale. Their locations in the dungeon you have to stay at until you board your plane give light to the complete lack of forethought by whomever designed this. Now you need a seat to wait for your plane. That too is horrendous, toxic experience with never enough, and the one I did find to sit in today at SW Gate 43, was sticky and there was a smell coming from the area around me. Decided to stand for the last hour until boarding. I will need to detox everything from my bags to myself before I step foot into my home. Not to mention complete detail my vehicle afterwards. Add to that there are not places to recharge your electronics at your seats like all other airports for your long stay in the cold, dark lifeless tunnels of a terminal unless you crowd around a small area with 1 or 2 outlets, like cows waiting on the evening trough meal. I see they have started a new terminal, but of course the designer there too was either stoned, blind, or has no architectural class whatsoever. And whom ever approved this so called improvement must have pockets lined with gold. You build a beautiful new terminal and then tower a gaudy concrete parking structure in front of it to hide what little majestic magic you were trying to show off. I was once proud to say KC was my home, but if this is the best foot forward you can show to our many visitors, returning Missourians, or International Flyers, then you should be removed. There are two pieces of sunlight that do exist in this total train wreck of an airport. (1) The rental car facility and staff still remain top notch. Whether spending big bucks or trying to save a few I have always be treated with grace, humility, and kindness on the buses, counters, and car parking lots. (2) Gate agents for SW and Delta (only two airlines I use) are always friendly and eager to help in anyway. Kansas City Airport (MCI) you need to seriously look over your customer service, facilities, and architectural managers and make a complete overhaul. Unless this is the look your are going for, draining the customers of all money, life, and happiness at which case you have nailed it.

commentHeader: the most poorly organized and dirty airport I have ever been in
reviewContent: This is without a doubt the most poorly organized and dirty airport I have ever been in. Here is a recap of my Kansas City Airport adventure. As the bus from the rental area drops you off at terminal C (American) door C10, you enter the building and can see overhead placards to the left and to the right both listing ticketing and gates. As my flight indicated C84 I headed towards the ticketing to the right. I dragged my bags nearly 1/4 mile around the curved building edge which obstructs your ability to see any distance beyond a hundred feet or so. After 8-9 minutes of walking I stopped dumfounded as the ticketing area that was revealed around the corner was Spirit and Delta. Not American Airlines. I completed an about face and walked all the way back to the C10 door. I double checked my ticket, double checked the sign and sure enough gate c84 was in fact the direction I headed. With no other choice I went the opposite direction and found the American Airlines ticketing center approx 150 yards in the opposite direction of my gate. Needless to say I shared my experience with 3 AA employees one of which was a supervisor. There is old used toilet paper on the ground right inside the terminal as you pass security. The restrooms haven't been cleaned in forever as is evident by the horrible urine stench, puddles of urine on the floor near the urinals, crusted urine stains on the toilets, the garbage is overfilled and used paper towels are spilled over onto the floor. As you walk through the terminal there is garbage on the ground, horribly stained carpet, food debris on most seats and literally piles of what appears to be mud/manure on the floor where someone had scraped their boots in the ground. Pretty sure I found the true origin of Covid. Yup in KCI.

I don't go to an airport to eat, or shop, or admire the furnishings. I go to catch a flight. Period. For people who live in the area, you can currently arrive at economy parking half an hour before your flight boards, take the shuttle to your gate, check in (with or without bags) and still easily make your flight. I have been doing this since 911 slowed things down. The city has embarked on a multi billion dollar new terminal "upgrade" to make our beloved airport a clone of larger markets. Long TSA lines, long treks to the gates (now it is about a 2 minute walk from check in to TSA). Separate TSA checkpoints at each cluster of gates means you get through in 5 minutes or so.), We are not a true hub. We don't want a hub. We have plenty of flights and the airlines compete for our business, resulting in lower airfares. The city stopped routine maintenance to strengthen their case for a new terminal. Had they done due diligence, the airport would have looked just fine. But the construction unions held sway and the travelling public here will now be paying increased ticket prices, laden with extra fees to pay for this. A giant step backward.

commentHeader: this is the dirtiest airport I have ever been in
reviewContent: I have traveled world wide and this is the dirtiest airport I have ever been in. The carpet, bathrooms and seating are all unkempt. I understand it may be an older airport, that is not the issue. It needs cleaning. The airport is easy to access and get around. Gate attendants were polite.

commentHeader: rude, obnoxious and angry at Passengers
reviewContent: TSA was extremely rude, obnoxious and angry at Passengers. They order people around and throw their personal items like they are Nazi's at a Concentration Camp. This "Agency" should be disbanded. They are a useless waste of my hard earned money that I pay to these rude morons to do nothing but harass citizens.

commentHeader: Where do these people come from
reviewContent: The TSA Agents were absolutely awful and down right ugly. There is absolutely no reason to treat any person they way the lady treated my son and I at the initial check in. She was wearing "2" masks and I could not hear a word she said and my 17 year old son could not understand a word she said either. We are not frequent travelers and this was our fist time at this airport and the lady should have been fired. She was ugly to every person I heard her dealing with. She yelled at all the line telling us there was a "glare" in her little box so we need to stand in a certain spot so she could see our face. Just wrong all the way around and customer service was zero, then we go to the line where you take off your shoes and go through that machine. Where do these people come from. I cannot believe TSA thinks it is fine to speak to people the way they do. It is down right awful.

commentHeader: the worst airport I have been in and I travel weekly
reviewContent: This is without a doubt the worst airport I have been in and I travel weekly. There is nothing here but chairs (with no outlets to charge electronics), seating is located next to security so it is noisy with bins and alarms, no lounges or restaurants just a fast food grab and go thing (Delta gates). People are crammed in like sardines in a can. This place is very old and has not been updated in decades from the look of it. If you have an option to fly into somewhere (anywhere) else you should take it!

commentHeader: bad for use of Economy Parking Lot
reviewContent: I understand MCI is undergoing construction but this airport has always been bad for use of Economy Parking Lot. Too few buses and one driver in particular is very rude. I refused to ride with her this morning, and she kept antagonizing me like she wanted to pick a fight. I waited 5 minutes for next bus and had a very pleasant ride. I have seen this bus driver act this way before so the airport must tolerate her behavior. This is just how Kansas City is, I guess.

Absolutely horrible place. They have signs for social distancing but pile people on top of each other. No soap, paper towels or functioning water faucet in the Ladies room. Filthy seats, nothing wiped down, food and garbage in seats. No maintenance people around and the airline ticket counter agents could care less. I will pay more to avoid a layover here next time. City of Kansas City you owe everyone who travels through here a big amends if we don't fall prey to the coronavirus here. Terrible place. Try to avoid especially if you have kids.

commentHeader: an embarrassment to the entire city
reviewContent: This airport is an embarrassment to the entire city. Inadequate equipment, incompetent staff, visually a joke. Worst airport I've seen in all my travels.
Flown through MCI multiple times, airport was dark and dingy, all the shops and restaurants were on the wrong side of security and the staff are rude. Overall needs major improvement.

Filthy, nasty carpet, dirty, dark, drab building with unclear confusing signs that will lead you to where you don't want to go. Tattered seats. Small tight dirty bathrooms that can only accommodate 4 women at a time. I refused to eat here despite being hungry due to the filth. Seriously who designed and maintains this horrible depressing place? I hope to never fly through here again. They need to tear the whole airport down and start over again.

This is the worst airport for a layover in a developed country! Where to start with a list of what's wrong? First, instead of having access to the entire terminal building as all other airports, travelers are crammed into about 6 gate areas and you cannot leave it without going through security again to get back in. That means you are stuck with limited services unless you want to go through the TSA line again. And what great services are available! Small one-holer bathrooms with 1970s designs that are dirty and smell, too few to accommodate everyone which causes long lines even in the mensroom. Restaurants that close at 7PM when my connecting flight does not depart until 8:25pm. Not enough chairs for everyone to sit. Ancient airline displays with plastic cards vs. modern terminals. I've been to third world countries with airports that are much better! I'll never layover here on a trip again. Southwest, you should be both ashamed & embarrassed that you call this airport a hub! I'll fly other airlines instead of flying through KC. You've lost my business.

commentHeader: this was my worst airport experience
reviewContent: The staff at this airport made the decision to not honor passengers with TSA precheck during a very busy holiday weekend. There was no communication indicating this was happening so we got into a very long security line with little time to spare. Then the TSA agent scanned and took both my luggage and backpack aside for an internal inspection of all contents. All of my luggage contents were removed then shoved back into my bags without any findings. Approximately 75% of all passenger bags were inspected without any findings. The security line was so confusing with bags being removed and belongings being removed that people were walking away and leaving their personal belongings at security. In a span of 5 minutes, 3 different TSA agents brought over laptops to the gate agent that people left behind. I also walked away without my laptop then quickly returned to retrieve it. The TSA agents were also very rude and not doing anything to resolve the long lines or chaotic situation! Once we got through the gate I was shocked to see how absolutely dirty the gate areas were, with trash on the ground everywhere and overflowing trash cans! We’ve traveled to this airport for many years and I’ve traveled to many airports in and outside of the US and this was my worst airport experience and I will never return.

commentHeader: a poor reflection of her position
reviewContent: I have always had pleasant experiences with the Kansas City airport until I was leaving the airport in my Uber. My Uber driver was cussed out by an older woman who was airport security with quite explicit language for trying to merge into the exiting lane. There were no signs and she was not directing traffic, but rather sitting in her car blocking the lane we were in. No biggie, due to us needing to scoot over into the left exiting lane. Just as we were merging, she jumped out of her car and began to profusely scream and swear, demanding we stop. She proceeded to allow every other car pass us and then walked to the back of my Uber drivers car to take his license. She did not come to the car nor give a ticket, so I am not quite sure why the explosive language and looking at the license plate. Her level of professionalism was pitiful and completely uncalled for. It was a poor reflection of her position. The rest of the experience at the Kansas City airport was super friendly and pleasant, as usual. My rating is solely based off of the explosive security woman. I reccomend this airport, but strongly believe someone should address the exiting lanes with class and clarity.

Staff are rude, car rental staff are even worse, no help loading our baby or luggage from shuttle to airport, and forced to cross dangerous roads in the process. One disgusting, uncleaned restroom for the women serving no less than 8 gates and a restaurant. They can't tear this place down fast enough. Flying into Tulsa from now on.

Worst airport ever. You are dropped out by ticketing then ensues an hour plus of hell. You check in then walk what feels like a mile to security entrance then retrace your steps inside secured area for another mile to get to the gate to find out you are trapped with no restrooms or amenities. Everyone waiting was moaning about the setup.

This place should be demolished at the earliest opportunity. Kansas City should be embarrassed to have this representing the city. All of the awful things people have said on this site about this Airport are true. I have a two hour layover here and I am counting the minutes until I can get out of this wretched place.

I am in a lot of airports and always find Kansas City security to be rude, disrespectful, humiliating. They will paw through your personal belongings and dump them all over the counter. Absolutely horrible experience.

commentHeader: This is the peak of stupidity
reviewContent: Arrival was no big deal. I left this morning. Walked through security. Was randomly selected as usual, then once allowed through I discovered that the gates don't connect. So I had to leave, go through security once again, where I was randomly selected, once again, the ladies ahead of me had to deal with the same thing and were annoyed. The workers there couldn't answer any of the questions they or anyone else had. The bathroom looked like it hadn't been cleaned since the day before, and the part that made me furious is that they threw out my toothpaste saying it wasn't allowed since they don't let you take in liquids over a certain amount, but one of the gate TSA people let a pilot carrying four cups of Starbucks coffee through the security door without hesitation. This is the peak of stupidity. All this about how they're making things safe for us when everyone knows the TSA is staffed by people who wouldn't make it at McDonalds.

What an embarrassment to Kansas City. Dark, dismal, no conveniences. The old state pen in Jefferson City is more inviting. Kansas City is a beautiful city with plenty to offer, but this gulag of an airport sure doesn’t reflect that. Step up your game, MCI.

The grossest airport I’ve ever been to. Bathrooms are filthy, food selection is poor, there’s probably half as much seating as there needs to be. I wanted to hold my breath the whole time I was there. I would legitimately consider routing my travel to a different airport next time. Additionally, upon my arrival, they could not locate my bag. Not necessarily MCI’s fault, but could have been handled better.

This is an absolutely wretched airport. Design is a nightmare. Food is worse than the convention center downtown - and that’s saying something. I ordered breakfast and it was honestly a pre-made/pre-cooked plastic-tray goopy mess. Bathrooms are wholly inadequate — and poorly serviced. Pre-packaged food in gate waiting area picked over and poor quality. Gate areas sardine-can crowded. I remember being in NYC’s Port Authority bus terminal in the late 1970s — this was worse. The city is lovely. The airport is a deterrent to wanting to ever come back to the city.

The worst airport for a lay-over I've ever been in! Limited bathroom facilities, dirty, small area to wait, a necessary trip outside of security if you want to look for gifts or food beyond a Pizza Hut and kiosks. An upstairs eatery and bar with no restrooms. I'll never layover here on a trip again. I'll change my destination before I'd go through this airport again. I've been to 3rd world and developing countries' airports with cleaner more available facilities!

My home town airport is disgraceful! My first complaint is that my family member and I were separated going through security. As of last Dec. 2017, they now send TSA Pre to a totally different gate for security check. Huh? When I asked one of the agents to explain, he was nasty and said it was easier for employees. I mentioned I didn’t like it. Oddly enough a few minutes later I was patted down for my Apple Watch and a nylon zipper on my pant leg pocket. What? I’ve worn the same pants through security before-no issues. My son was not patted down for his Apple Watch. The bathrooms at the gates are terrible. No soap or paper towels-gross. MCI-do something!

Arrived 2 hrs early in frigid temps with a carry on. People checking bags at SW lined up outside! After killing time for 30 min I happily moved to a side line so Seattle passengers only would get routed through the slow security check. It feels good to cooperate. Finally 30 min later Seattle customers done and all in line are feeling good. Our line was split in 2 and those who had been waiting the longest were in the TSA pre check, which I paid to have too. Then I watched as not only was our line ignored as the pre check, but also as the customers who had been waiting in line the longest. The agent who had asked us all to move aside, suddenly was making no eye contact and didn't say a word to the agents checking our tickets. I'm tired of being polite and helpful and then basic customer service ignored. People in line longest are next customer served.

commentHeader: need to carry out huge changes
reviewContent: I am surprised this airport has one star. Not sure where to start, small, get full even with a small number of passengers. It smells and the worst part is? There is only one bathroom in the entire 50s gates area, don't know which line is longer, the TSA security or the bathroom lines. Officials need to carry out huge changes to this airport. Look at the picture I added for bathroom line.

Long overdue for replacement. If you have carry-on only, you can skip the long lines at the ticket counter in hopes of getting into the security line sooner. TSA Pre only recently became an option for AA travelers, and the newly renovated gate area for AA now links all their gates, but it still suffers the same problems that Southwest’s gate area in B does - lack of seating, no clear and direct paths between gates, sparse charging ports (and finding one that actually works is even harder). Food options airside are minimal and horribly overpriced, usually consisting of day-old factory made sandwiches, wilted salads, and $8 bottles of juice.

commentHeader: the worst major airport in America
reviewContent: If you like having zero options for food (or paying $10 for a cold and stale sandwich), having to go through security to use the bathroom, and being in extremely close proximity to people going through security checks as you connect to your next flight, Kansas City Airport is the place for you. This is easily the worst major airport I've ever been to. There are only two restaurants, and both somehow seemed like 1 and 1A for the title of "Saddest Place on Earth". When your best food option is a microwaved sandwich from Starbucks, you know you're in a whole new level of suck. Also, for some odd reason, half of the airport is walled off and is inaccessible to the general populous. Why? Good question. This isn't Westeros. I have heard from locals that the airport provides easy in and out access, which could possibly be true. But the fact that this place hasn't been updated since the 70's is incredible, and the shocking lack of restaurants and cleanly bathrooms make Kansas City International seem like the worst major airport in America.

I'm sitting in the B gates area now waiting out a 3 hour weather delay. The women's restroom for all B gates only has 3 stalls. There was no soap, paper towels, or toilet paper. Southwest has put in charging stations, but the actual airport offers few, if any. To get to nicer food or restroom options, be prepared to leave security and be re screened in order to get to your flight. The gate seating area is inadequate for a full flight of passengers. Be prepared to camp out on the floor.

commentHeader: transfer procedure totally outdated and unacceptable
reviewContent: I arrived American Eagle terminal C at Kansas City Airport, and had a departure connection with Alaska Airlines (SkyWest) terminal B. I had to exit the airport, take a shuttle bus and go back through TSA security. The airport was crowded and very confusing. I travel a minimum of 4 times a year and at age 77 I am quite capable of getting around with ease and understand directions. All airport employees, bus drivers, and airline agents were very friendly and helpful in a difficult situation as I had a short connection time. Once I arrived at terminal B, I immediately went to the Alaska Airline customer counter. The agent printed up a new boarding pass with TSA pre-check printed and marked with yellow highlighter. The agent then escorted myself and several others to the TSA check point, and explained to the TSA agent that the plane was in boarding process. The TSA check line was backed up. The agent explained they were not equipped for TSA Precheck and we would go through the routine boarding process. I followed instructions removing my CPAP machine from the original case, before placing it on the screening belt. Removed my shoes, and proceeded through the screen machine. I set it off and explained I was wearing suspenders, I was told to go back, another agent came up saw my suspenders, and politely explained to her co-worker I was wearing suspenders. I was told to go back through the screen machine, of course I set it off again. After lifting my shirt and showing the agent once again the suspenders the agent said put your shirt down (I was wearing a t-shirt under the suspenders) so no skin was showing. Another agent than began the long process of explaining the pat down all the while the plane was boarding. The agent commenced with the pat down process. His pat down was humiliating. Once I boarded the plane several passangers remarked "they sure gave you tough time". The work load on TSA would be greatly reduced if MCI Airport could make it so it is not necessary to go through security when changing terminals from one airline to another. The current transfer procedure is totally outdated and unacceptable.

commentHeader: departure gates are crowded and noisy
reviewContent: This airport reminded me of other woefully inadequate facilities like LaGuardia. The circular terminal building was never meant to have the secure area splitting the length of the entire concourse. Travelers in transit have to exit the sterile area for the larger bathrooms and better food choices. The departure gates are crowded and noisy. This place is awful, and I'll avoid connections here in the future.

I am a Kansas City resident who travels frequently for my job so am very familiar with other airports around the country. I am appalled at how far my hometown airport has deteriorated. The bathrooms are despicable! Filthy and in disrepair every single time I travel which is 2 to 3 times per month. The food choices are sparse and extremely expensive as compared to other airports. It's time KC woke up and does something about the airport.

This place is awful. I feel as though I am in a cattle yard. Having to go through security just to use the restroom is ridiculous. Talk about deterring people from flying. 1 bathroom "inside" the wall to service passengers is bogus. I will never fly through this aiport again. Avoid this place, even if it means paying more for a non-stop ticket. Lesson learned.

commentHeader: a terrible place to get stuck
poor lighting, poor food option, depressing

reviewContent: There is some debate around this airport. There is TSA prechecked, other reviews said none, at the Delta gates for 56-60 and there was a longer queue there than I have seen at any other airport. There is very little after the security except a bottle of water less than a liter for more than $5 and I could not find any water fountain. Small and narrow in a rainbow shape. Even the check in for Sky priority was slower than everyone else.

commentHeader: the worst airport experience I've had

reviewContent: Leaving travelers sitting in the tarmac for over an hour when there is no weather on site after a cross country flight is not acceptable. We can see the weather now rolling on meaning this hour will be extended further escalating aggravation onboard. The airline was quick to clear us as landed in their system to give the facade of a timely travel experience but that is a complete fabrication of the truth. MCO needs to improve the quality of the experience for a city that is supposed to be welcoming of its travelers.

Why is MCO getting worse with each passing week? As a frequent flyer, out of all three terminals, across several carriers, this airport is pathetic. Between the sheer lack of on site parking, the lack of employees that speak English and unimaginably poor ground service, I loathe this place. I will do anything I can to avoid checking a bag because I know I am in for a minimum of a 30 minute wait at baggage claim. That’s on a good day. The wait for a gate to taxi to, the wait for a jet way brought to the plane, then the incredible, inevitable wait at baggage. Carry on only isn’t always an option for me. As one waits, the announcements are made at times only in Spanish, but when they do make it in English, usually secondary to the Spanish, it’s incomprehensible. Listen at any baggage claim, you’ll hear passengers complaining about them. After a ridiculous wait, when you finally get your bag, it’s smash to bits. Every.Single.Time. Of every airport I travel, world wide, my home airport, MCO, is a disaster.

The TSA women are horrible with no manners. They should be saying “thank you for visiting, come back again”. Instead they tell me this is not Universal this is Orlando International Airport when I’m going through the scanner. They speak harshly to some and are nice to some. Second time departing Orlando and they tell me I have something between my legs. They told me either they feel me all over in front of everyone or they take me to a room to strip down. Mind you I’m traveling with a small child. They really need to learn courtesy and be more polite. Is this how they are being trained? This is the Jet Blue TSA ; one had gray hair and the other had red short hair. They picked up my sun screen in my carryon but not the big Fuji bottle in my son’s bag smh. So much for checking and security!

commentHeader: does not have enough parking spaces
reviewContent: My wife arrived on Flight AD8706 arrived 6PM sharp and my wife only left the luggage's/immigration at 7:50. Between the airplane get the finger, luggage available, it took 1 hour and 40 minutes. Immigration was quick. Also the terminal does not have enough parking spaces for it's current operations. This was the third time parking A and C where closed and I had to park elsewhere. Luckily I learned how to park at train station and walked 20 minutes to airport C, avoiding a 30 minutes walking from B parking to C.

This airport has a extremely large number of visitors. Ground transport and flow to and from are fine. Concessions facilities and restaurants are far and few between 1 sit down bar restaurant for many gates waiting lines everywhere, all facilities both male and female have long lines. Very far behind the times, would rather fly to any other airport in they area.

commentHeader: continues to get worse and worse
reviewContent: I live in Orlando, so use this airport frequently. I don't know what is happening but it continues to get worse and worse. I flew internationally for holiday and returned last evening (April 15th). I left out of Terminal A and returned to Terminal C. I parked in North Lot. Apparently you can take a shuttle from C to the South Lot but not the North Lot. WHY? So I had to take a shuttle to Terminal A to then take another shuttle to my vehicle in North Lot. The shuttle took forever to arrive to C. I saw other shuttles (Mears, off site parking etc) circle two or three times while I waited for the shuttle to take me to A. When it did arrive, me and other other 3 passengers all informed him we were going to A, however he dropped us at Terminal B and told us that was his only stop. So I then had to drag my luggage across the airport to get to Terminal A to catch the next shuttle. That shuttle arrived slightly faster, however the driver didn't even get out of his seat to help any of the passengers board. He just sat there staring at us. A nice passenger helped me load my luggage onboard. I had asked a couple people in the airport how to get where i was going and one girl actually told me "it wasn't her job to answer that question". When I did get to my vehicle and went to pay and leave the attendant couldn't have been any more annoyed that I was trying to pay her. She barely could extend her arm to take my payment and seemed severely pissed off she had to actually perform a function. I traveled to three countries and therefore three airports and am sadly embarrassed how our city is represented with regard to our airport. After customs and retrieving my bags, it took me 2 hours to get to my vehicle last night which is horrible. Why is there no shuttle to North Lot from C? Why doesn't the shuttle that is supposed to take you to A not actually take you to A? Why are the workers so rude and unhelpful. Really poor on MCO's part.
Worst wheelchair assistance experience ever. Attendant assigned to me did not speak enough English to understand my needs, ended up parking me off to the side and walked away!

This was the worst airport experience in my life. Very Rude People. Very Few Facilities.  The public announcements were a joke and they were being read like it a joke by a person who sounded about 10 years old. They kept repeating that people are not allowed to use phones in the terminal, and yet looking around guess what, everyone is on their phones because that's what travellers need to do! Being asked to pay $30 for a baggage trolley. (£1 in the UK). Massive queues for the immigration lanes - we waited for over 2 hours. This terminal is very badly designed. No opportunity to purchase any refreshments and no seats. There are no shops whatsoever in the airport on the way to the hire car. (we rented a villa so a shop would have been really handy) Outbound - Similar experience, very few shops and no opportunity to buy any duty free. Encountered extremely rude & cranky TSA operatives. I ended up getting angry myself at the way I was being shouted at and left my iPad/tablet behind. It would have been fine but the tray with this item ended up on a different conveyer belt and I didn't realise I'd left it behind until I was on the flight. To add insult to injury, MCO Lost and Found have said the only option to get my item returned will cost me $349 via UPS. This is an absolute joke as the UPS website quotes me a fraction of this price. The item itself is worth about $150. When you consider MCO auctions thousands of lost electrical items for profit (ggauctionsonline.net), this little operation seems to be lining somebody's pockets at MCO. I had high hopes for this visit but I never dreamt I'd end up being financially exploited by the richest country in the world.

The airport staff and TSA were crotchety, not at all helpful with my disabled family member either. A lady stands at the family and disabled TSA line entrance and basically gate keeps it. We explained we had an autistic family member and she still tried to deny us access, she was so rude. Not at all up on the TSA cares policy in the least!  Do not recommend. Oh but don't worry they gave me a sunflower lanyard that no one paid any attention to.

commentHeader: a big improvement on previous visits
reviewContent: Arrival and departure into the new Terminal C at MCO. I have to say it was terrific. Through immigration in 10 minutes and into a rental car 15 min after that. Departure was equally as good. No Queues at security and a good selection of Eating places, including Shake shack. We only had hand luggage which is important to state, but it was a big improvement on previous visits.

commentHeader: Shockingly poor from start to finish
reviewContent: Shockingly poor from start to finish. Could not disembark on arrival as ground crew had a problem with connecting equipment - about 30 minutes extra. Allegedly only ‘one belt’ was working for baggage - waited 2 hours with lack of seating, people lying on the floor etc waiting to get bags. We asked if our elderly parents could go through passport control and get a seat, while we waited for the luggage. We were told yes, this would be fine. Then when our parents attempted to do this they were spoke to in a demeaning tone and said they couldn’t do this. Totally understand that things can go wrong in any industry, but a timely, consistent and courteous approach are some of the best ways of dealing with problems and maintaining or improving customer relationships and experiences. Orlando Airport is the worst airport I have ever had to use.

I have unfortunately had to travel to or through MCO with some frequency over the years and it is always chaotic and the employees have no sense of urgency. To get through the line to have baggage checked by security can take very little time but the screening process takes forever if they have to pull your bags. It requires a supervisor who has led feet and all slow the process down and make things annoyingly tedious. There were 4 people in wheelchairs awaiting their baggage for almost a half hour while I and 4 others were also waiting for someone to expedite the process of opening and checking bags.  Service is slow all over, there is nowhere to sit and when you do find a seat it’s covered in crumbs, old turkey and goo from the 1980s. No where to charge your phone or get work done. Not business friendly whatsoever.  No retail spaces to pass the time. Folks sitting on the floors everywhere you look. The only pluses are that’s it’s usually cheap, car rental return is easy and the tram always seems pretty clean. Just get some real seating please.

One of the worst tourist airports I have visited. Over two hours for baggage to be retrieved on arrival and then an incredibly slow departure from the airport as you pass through customs. On departure, only 2 out of 12 security lines open (in the middle of the day) which resulted in over an hour queue to exit. This is my third trip through Orlando airport in the last four months and it’s a consistently poor experience every time.
The TSA was very rude and did not treat people as customers. They were confused about what they wanted you to do, and then they started yelling at people. Very poor service!

This is the worst Airport ever! My son was scheduled to depart from there last night when his flight was delayed. Then they got on the next flight but it left the gate only to return back to the airport. They were told that they were going to have to board a different flight due to something with the plane. Only to find out that they wouldn't be able to board another flight departing until Saturday. The airline nor airport would accommodate them in no way. I have been calling since last night until current leaving messages and getting the run around. This was my son 1st experience on a plane to celebrate his birthday and look what happens. There's no direct customer service number for the airline which doesn't make sense.

Upon arrival at Orlando the Customs were excellent and very quick, our luggage arrived very promptly too - we opted to take our luggage on the mono-rail with us and were out of the airport within 45 minutes - excellent service all round. We also Departed on 11th May, the departure was awful, our Virgin Check-in was faultless, the Security was AWFUL, so long and disorganised, its been like this for the last 22 years and never gets any better, very long queues and half the security lanes closed - why! (the staff though are lovely). When we got to the area where we departed from all the food areas were closed (9pm), our flight did not leave until 10.20 - Outback Steak House could not seat us as they only had 1 member of staff working, it was the same for the other outlet. The Duty Free, which is the worst Duty Free I have ever seen, no stock at all also shut at 9pm! If you have flights going out with 100's of people of those flights you should have some outlets open to feed them, the lounges close at 9pm too. Totally unacceptable service.
Restrooms outdated and small. Staff is slow and unwilling to help. Security lines can be up to a mile. Limited seating at the gates. Expect to walk a lot navigating terminals and the trams.

commentHeader: never experienced a new terminal as bad as this
reviewContent: I have never experienced a new terminal as bad as this. You have to walk half a mile up hill to get to baggage claim after a long flight. I saw people stopped and hyperventilating. Then the wait for bags is absurdly long. I am not quite sure if they have more than a few people unloading planes. Then the border patrol guy gave me a lecture on how wonderful Florida is because you don’t pay income tax. I see what not paying income tax does to infrastructure. Then rechecking bags is confusing and unclear. Overall I give the new MCO a D minus.

As a frequent flyer and Orlando area resident, I was flabbergasted by the impoverished appearance and user unfriendliness of this brand new terminal C. Plain, unadorned beige walls. Shockingly scuffed and marred floors. Crudely finished bathroom floor. Marathon walk to bag claim. It looked like a low bid renovation of a bus terminal. The huge ceiling height and skylights made me wonder about cooling costs. I felt bad for my fellow travelers, walking the long distances after a 10 hour flight, undistracted by color, design, or assistance. I appreciated the airport ambassador who directed us, and the courteous passport control folks. However, I am shocked by this building, and embarrassed for the image of Orlando that it gives to visitors to the City Beautiful.

The new terminal in Orlando is terrible. Lines are long, service is lacking and rude, the building is very big and confusing. Took almost an hour to get our luggage and then we had to wait another 10+ minutes to get a walker (brought from somewhere else - it was on the same plane). Will not book any MCO flights in the future with any carrier in that terminal.

Wait times are insane. People arriving 2+ hours early were missing flights left and right because security lines were taking more than an hour and 15 minutes. We made our flight with 30 seconds to spare after SPRINTING through the airport.

commentHeader: Our luggage took one hour to arrive
reviewContent: We arrived at Orlando via Terminal C which is the terminal BA and Aer Lingus to name but two now use for their flights. On arrival we had to go upwards via a sloped incline to arrive at an upper level where a sign indicated how far it was to baggage reclaim (it stated an 8 minute walk). This is not at all accurate for families with small children or for anyone with any sort of mobility issue. There are no moving walkways of any kind or seating prior to arriving into the baggage reclaim area prior to entering immigration/passport control. Our luggage that day took one hour to arrive; this was due to inclement weather and problems with unloading the aircraft. Some of the TSA staff at departures could benefit from more training in customer relations. Airside area is clean and has a few shops and eating places in it prior to arrival at the gate area. Be prepared for a long walk to your flight if your gate for this is at the end of the corridor.

commentHeader: worst to spend any time in at all
reviewContent: Of all the airports, this is the worst to spend any time in at all. NO working outlets for charging phones or electronics. Restrooms for women require long waits and today was relatively clean, but in the past has not been good at all. Limited food vendors and few choices. I avoid this airport whenever possible and really wish it was traveler friendly. People sitting on the floor because there are not enough seats. Queue lines in the walkway that makes it difficult to move around.

Who designed this monstrosity? This is the absolute worst airport experience I've ever had, and the absolute worst at MCO. We arrived yesterday at Terminal C from a British Air 9-hour flight. We were met with an uphill incline (and we had baggage with us). We are in our 70s and had to stop several times to catch our breath. Besides the steep incline, this is very antiseptic looking. Once I regained my breathing, I thought to myself that if I were a first-time traveler to the United States, I'd want to turn around and go home. Took a long time to get baggage, but we were on a large plane. Our plane arrived early at 6:25 pm, and our ticket said 6:50 arrival. We had family coming to pick us up, and they had to keep circling around. We left Terminal C around 7:30 pm. Absolutely ridiculous. Worst news for me is that I'm scheduled to fly Icelandair in November, and I'll be dreading that arrival for the next several months. Invest a buck or two, people! Install some escalators!

Everything from parking, lines at ticket counters, security, food kiosks and restaurants are all crowded and severely understaffed. You don’t have time to complete a purchase because the lines are long with usually one employee serving a very long line. Hyatt hotel is overpriced, air conditioning doesn’t work well. Rooms are humid despite being cooler. Sub par all the way around.

commentHeader: worst airport I have ever been to
reviewContent: The worst airport I have ever been to. Over an hour now getting through security. Very close to missing my flight. Machines that I think were operating in the 80's. Understaffed but yet incompetent and uncaring security. This airport is/should be an embarrassment to the state of Florida

Orlando MCO guest services need to have professional training, in the event when you have a delayed flight that turns into a canceled flight with customers who have been waiting on a flight from 5:40pm to 11:40pm with children involved it becomes a high stress environment for everyone, the fact that the staff where mocking customers laughing at customers and taking their frustrations out on customers that was just uncalled for uncomfortable.

Its 9:30 pm - our flight was delayed. Food stores are closed. The duty free is closed. This is an international airport - at 9:30 pm everything is closed and some Which are still open are closing at 10pm. So their food is all done. Travelling with my 80 year old Mom who is diabetic and can't find anything for her to eat.

Where to start, from the extremely long walks, starting at security, the tiny bathrooms (only two stalls) lack of seating, limited food options. From last gate 230 to main hall where most the food is will take you 15-20 minutes to walk there. The upside down nature departures on lower levels, aerials on upper. Constant elevation changes. Don’t know why you would put carpet on the international walkways. Airports have been in operations for a century and designers still can’t figure them out. Oh and don’t forget the walk to train to walk if you are connecting to another airline plan 40 minutes at minimum. Waste of 2.8 billion if you ask me

I felt overly confined at this airport on how you have to take a shuttle to get in and out of it. I brought carry on so as to keep the trip chaotic free and an attendant that was checking the bags through the device chose to take one of my bags further and took two containers away. One was a gel that was over 3.5 oz. The other was a solid sea salt scrub and he claimed it was a gel and did not look into the container to see the texture of it. You have the scrape the product out with a stick it is so stiff. If that couldn't go on the plane as a carry on why was my deodorant allowed? I feel It was a pure and easy theft. I don't think it's right for one attendant to have the only judgement in order to get away with taking anything they pleases like that.

commentHeader: issues that need to be addressed"
reviewContent: Although the expansion of Orlando airport is amazing, there are some issues that need to be addressed. Size of terminal, and lack of assisted transportation for those with disabilities. Coordination of rental car agencies. We arrived in terminal C and needed to find transportation back to terminal B. This took about an hour to finally get to our rental vehicle. Should have assigned or made it possible to pick up a car at terminal C. I understand that terminal C opened recently, logistics around the airport should have be planned as the terminal was being built. A lot seems to be after thoughts.

Inconsiderate staff. Complete mess and utter chaos. Airport setup is confusing. No coordination whatsoever. Good luck finding your way around in this labyrinth. International flight and domestic flight were departing from the same terminal which made everyone miss their flight. Any sort of argument or pleading with the staff was futile.

Lines for checking in were understaffed so the lines were long and unpleasant. The lines for going through security were impossibly long. That area was clearly understaffed. The monitor claimed it would take 23-25 minutes, but it took us 45 minutes. The waiting area for Delta was filthy. The chairs were disgusting. Many of the chairs were actually broken. There were not enough places for people to sit. The food available was very substandard, and the selection was way too limited. The bathrooms were marginal and unpleasant. Often 2 or 3 announcements were blasting at the same time making it impossible to understands any of them.

commentHeader: Terminal C arrival is a nightmare
reviewContent: Terminal C arrival is a nightmare. After a 4 hour delay we arrived late, the walk from the gate to the baggage claim is long. Very difficult for even minor mobility issues. There were at least places to stop and rest along the way. It is a very long walk across multiple levels with no moving sidewalks or golf carts. It probably took me 1/2 hour to reach the baggage claim where I waited another hour for the bags. Decided to walk over to the car rental desk to find out where to get the car. Turns out you either have another long walk to take the tram to terminal B or you wait 30 mins for a bus. My flight landed at 10 and I got to my Disney Hotel at 2.00 am. Will be hard pressed to fly any airlines using Terminal C unless they make improvements.

Terminal C is horrible. Very poorly designed. The walk from the gate to baggage is so long with no people movers. I use a walker and I know that no one with any kind of mobility issues will be able to walk the half mile to baggage. To get to baggage also requires going up two levels. Yes there are elevators but the buttons are at the end of the bank of 3. I literally pushed the button 3x and the elevator opened and closed before I could reach it. The fourth time I ran and managed to jam my walker into the closing door to get it to open. Signage is also not very clear, but three of us finally figured out how to get to baggage. I was last off the plane, had to wait 10 min for my walker, took 20 min to walk at a decent pace to get to baggage, was directed to the wrong carousel and when I arrived at the correct carousel the bags still were not coming out. There were 5 stops before I finally got my bag over 30 minutes AFTER I reached baggage. From the time we reached the gate until I got my bag, was over 70 minutes! At the VERY LEAST this terminal needs people movers. If you have ANY mobility issues or are even a little out of shape count on 20 min to get to your gate you are almost forced to take a wheelchair even if you normally can navigate with a cane or walker. Terminal C is a nightmare. I hope they correct the problems before I fly Jetblue again. So poorly designed.

Orlando airport terminal C has a steep walk of about 10 minutes upon arrival. This is not consumer friendly at all, particularly for older people like myself and my wife. They don’t have any alternative arrangement like escalator or elevator. This is really shameful! No other airport in the US or anywhere in the world is so unfriendly and inconsiderate to senior citizens like us.

commentHeader: Terminal C is not age friendly
reviewContent: A brand new Terminal C. Once you have checked in and head towards security they have a coral. Now with 8 people already at security and a attendant or whatever they call her standing there. My husband who is 80 and suffers from Neurapathy and I am 70 suffers from arthritis we had to walk back and forth back and forth about 6 time. It did not occur to this person to lift the rope for us to go straight ahead as there was nobody else there. I could understand if there was a queue. This Terminal C is not age friendly. The next time we fly Aer Lingus we will have to take a wheel chair that otherwise would not be needed .

Just returned from Thanksgiving trip on JetBlue from Albany NY. Our trip out was easy enough but our return was a nightmare. We arrived at 8.03 at Terminal C. Had to walk over a 1/2 mile from the gate to baggage claim, up 2 floors to get to baggage claim area. There was no tram cars available to get a ride on. I am 75 yrs old and my wife is 72. We both have to issues walking distances, and needed to stop a few times to carry on. At the baggage claim we didn’t get our bags until 9.00. This is not a terminal to use for the elderly or those who have problems walking.

Terminal C - what happened with the design of this $2 Billion investment? The parking lot is a nightmare! The arrival hall is on the second floor and the departure on the bottom. Who flipped it on its head? The train station is bigger than average European airport train stations and there are no trains for at least another year and then there will only be a train that goes in one direction to Miami and stops in Cape Canaveral for the cruise connection. Everything in this airport is awkward to say the least. All the food outlets are after security and the multi floor building looks like a greenhouse that lets the sun in - and this in Florida? What about sustainability and eco friendly mess.  I am saddened at the thought of the expense of such an expansion of a major airport that starts of at the wrong foot. It is clear that the designers never traveled abroad and checked in at other airports from Beijing to Singapore or Hong Kong just to mention a few new airports that are inviting and welcoming.  The proof is clearly in the day to day operation: I counted 20 ambassadors helping travelers find their way just from the parking lot to the security area on a regular light travel afternoon. Check it out for yourself!

commentHeader: Arrival at the new terminal C was a joke
reviewContent: Arrival at the new terminal C was a joke. First the key code to the jetway was lost so we waited 40+ minutes to get off of the plane. Than you have to walk a half mile to the baggage claim up a maze of walkways that are not friendly to passengers that are ederly or have health issues. Than there were only a few customs agents and 500-600 people trying to get through. Took an hour from plane through customs. Than nobody picks up at C because its to far away so you have to walk another half of a mile to the tram, take it to A or B and then catch your transportation. We could have driven to Fort Lauderdale and flown from there and it would have been faster than traveling terminal C. The desighn is terrible.  I blew out my knee 3 weeks ago and it was just on the mend and now it's re-inflamed. This terminal should be shut down.

We used to like this airport, but terminal C is a nightmare! 15 minutes until our airplane reached it's parking position, then a 10 minute walk to the baggage claim - no moving walkways - very bad, if you had a long flight, waiting for the bags to arrive and then waiting again for immigration. We touched ground at 6.15pm and exited the airport around 8pm - there were only 2 other flights coming in at that time, imagine, what happens, if it is busy.

commentHeader: Terminal C just isn't ready for passengers
reviewContent: Terminal C just isn't ready for passengers. Poor/no road signage, no staff on hand for assistance, no car rentals available, baggage claim woefully inadequate, not allowed to bag drop at terminal instead have to go to terminal A&B and make the long hot outdoor journey from the train to terminal, no trolleys available for transfer to terminal, poor seating, no decent restaurants open, no vending machines, restrooms soaking wet with no hand soap, all staff claim not to work there. Only upside is TSA employees actually have a personality. Honestly, be prepared to be underwhelmed and bring water.

Absolutely worst TSA service out of every airport I've ever flown from and/or to. My girlfriend is a diabetic and we were waiting on our connecting flight. I asked 3 different TSA agents whether we would be allowed back through after having to leave out the terminal to even find a vending machine. All 3 said that we could re-enter with no problem. Once we attempted to reenter we were then told that we couldn't and would have to wait until 3am when they could process us because our flight left at 0830. Keep in mind I had already provided connecting flight info to the 3 that I previously asked to avoid having to wait in the long line that will be formed by then. Not a one mentioned that I would have to wait. All 3 told me and my girlfriend that as long as we were back by 12am then we could get through. To make it even better, the night supervisor Alberto was extremely rude and unprofessional and talked to me like I was below him and had a very condescending attitude. I will be directly contacting TSA regarding this and this will be the only time that I ever set foot in this airport again. Any future travel plans to the city of Orlando are hereby gone from my thoughts if this is the quality of service that they provide.

commentHeader: 75 minutes to get through passport control
reviewContent: We landed at the airport and it took over 7 minutes to reach our docking station at Terminal C. We were some of the first off due to the class of ticket we had purchased. We then had a 7 minute walk up hill to reach the baggage claim area. There were 4 such carousels and we waited just under 1 hour to collect out bags.
